100011.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has limited research on Alpeca. After briefly studying its behavioral pattern of spewing liquid Ether, the Association classified Alpeca as a low-threat Ethereal and ended its investigation.
Scholars once showed great interest in observing how Alpeca spews liquefied Ether and even commissioned surveys for closer observation.
Experienced investigators have been avoiding such tasks for unknown reasons, however.
"Run! They're spitting again... Oh, no! My new clothes!"

20012.desc:
Unfortunate souls mutated by the intense corruption of Ether matter within the Hollows. Due to a considerable degree of Ether aptitude and physical capability, their bodies have not been completely transformed by the Ether, retaining humanoid features but with enhanced mutant limbs that are more dangerous.
Judging from the remnants of clothing and its combat experience, it was likely once a senior gang member or Raider lurking in the Hollows.
These corrupted subjects, potentially due to their enhanced physiology or affinity for Ether matter, have developed formidable close combat abilities, making them even more menacing than the typical monsters found in the Hollow.
"Their weapons look very fancy... and kinda like they came as freebies."

200052.desc:
Many novice Hollow Raiders who come across an Arlaune for the first time are often deceived by its appearance, mistakenly assuming it to be a harmless plant.
However, upon approaching it, they discover that Arlaune release a concentrated discharge of Ether matter, catching their unsuspecting victims off guard.
"Huh? I tried to water it, and it spat at me?"

940003.desc: The Rampant Brute is a highly dangerous enemy. He can deal <color=#D9A600>massive DMG</color> to targets, so when using Paperboo to block him, be sure to deploy Kind Bangboo strategically to ensure <color=#D9A600>Paperboo's</color> safety!

300401.desc:
Even among Ionized enemies renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers are exceptionally unique.

These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. Both in detail and texture, it is almost impossible to tell apart from the original.

Even more challenging is their ability to mimic the powerful and intimidating combat techniques of their targets.

No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable challengers from their opponent's memories, and then attack in that form.

"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
300401.JA: ドッペルゲンガー・狛野真斗

30002.desc:
The Defense Force will only dispatch the fully armed mechs known as Guardians during operations in large-scale Hollows.
These mechs are equipped with active Ether shock blasters, Ether-charging guns MARS-74, and even fusion heat rays... causing the Guardian to often be referred to as Public Security's mobile arsenal.
Despite their formidable firepower, they possess impressive mobility, enabling them to jump and sprint while dispersing groups of lesser Ethereals and advancing the front lines.
For Hollow Raiders, encountering a single Guardian is akin to facing an impregnable fortress.
"I'll strike in my Fortress Form!"

930156.desc: Vicious Striker <color=#D9A600>has high HP</color>. Focus your fire on them.

20005.desc:
Many novice Hollow Raiders who come across an Arlaune for the first time are often deceived by its appearance, mistakenly assuming it to be a harmless plant.
However, upon approaching it, they discover that Arlaune release a concentrated discharge of Ether matter, catching their unsuspecting victims off guard.
"Huh? I tried to water it, and it spat at me?"

930178.desc:
A fallen creation, reshaped in the depths of profound darkness and impurity.

This fearsome Ethereal, named after a warrior tribe in ancient mythology, is said to only manifest from the most valiant heroes and the most insane villains when they become corrupted by the Ether.
That is not the case, however. While the chiseled muscles you developed in the Hollow and the adrenaline released in excess before death may indeed help you become a significant nuisance to your former companions, they probably won't hold it against an old friend who's already beyond saving, right?
Not that it matters, of course. Who cares about street cred or socializing once your handsome face has transformed into a dark, eerie energy orb, anyway?
"That's the Boss for ya. Even his Ether-corrupted form is super strong!"
"I always knew something was off about that gym freak!"
930178.JA: ミアズミック・トラキアン

100041.desc:
According to research reports conducted by the Hollow Investigative Association, Blastcrawlers, with their low mobility and causing only small explosions, are classified as a "low-threat," "non-concern" lower-tier Ethereal.
However, astute businessmen have recognized the opportunities presented by their rounded bodies and short legs.
A film titled "Roll Over, Little Blastcrawler" gained significant popularity, leading to the sale of merchandise like Blastcrawler dolls and pillows at remarkably high prices.
"I didn't expect their dolls to be more deadly than the real deal... on your wallet at least. Looks like I'll be surviving on instant noodles next month, Billy..."
100041.JA: ブラストスパイダー・蓄エネ型

100261.desc:
Influenced by the distinctive decor of the interior of the Ballet Twins, Specters have the grotesque and twisted limb configuration of an artistic sculpture.
Some investigators believe its unique shape is intended to enhance the protection of its Ether Core.
Others argue it's merely a trick designed to distract its enemies. While its enemies are mesmerized by its peculiar posture, a Specter will seize the opportunity to launch long-range attacks using concentrated Ether.
"I looked at its bizarre structure and thought to myself: Was it trying to play a game of bowling with its own head?"
"But before I could make sense of anything, its bowling ball had already smashed into my face..."
100261.JA: スペクター・蓄エネ型

20032.desc: Not all Ionized beings within the Hollows prefer to hide, and Pugnus wears its menace on every sharpened spike. Clad in armor, its back and tail bristle with razor spines, while its massive pincers serve not only as weapons but as war drums that pound the earth to mark its territory. Pugnus tends to build power from within the shadows, yet can suddenly spring forth — bringing its full weight down with both crushing claws upon its prey. Its shockwaves are powerful enough to throw inexperienced fighters off balance, and the flying debris that follows often seals off any escape routes. Its attack rhythm suggests it relies on ground vibrations to track its prey before lunging in a sudden, explosive strike to finish the fight. Interestingly, some Hollow Raiders who've spent years dealing with Pugnus have developed a unique "Lightfoot Hollow Step" technique: "I used to get knocked off balance by its tremors, but then I learned to step on my toes and move quickly... Now I'm somehow winning stilts racing competitions at festivals."

200004.desc:
Farbauti, possessing immense strength and often in a frenzied state, is one of the most formidable threats Hollow Raiders may face. Its hammer-like arms can effortlessly deflect damage and unleash storms of blows that crush everything in its path.
Some Hollow Raiders have observed Farbauti frequently pounding the ground in a rhythmic, high-frequency manner, leading to speculation about its peculiar interest in drumming music.
Despite the Hollow Investigative Association publicly debunking this rumor, many Hollow Raiders carry portable stereos in an attempt to distract Farbauti with music.
No successful escapes using this method have been reported however.
"The reason for their failure is simple: Even Farbauti think your taste in music sucks!"
200004.JA: 電離体・ファールバウティ

300371.desc:
A fallen creation, reforged in the depths of filth and gloom.
Even among Ionized enemies known for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers stand out as particularly exceptional.
These creatures cloak themselves in a special layer of active Ether ions, allowing them to precisely mimic the appearance of their targets — sometimes so accurately it's nearly impossible to tell the difference. From details to texture, they're masters at blurring the line between real and false.
What makes them even more dangerous is their ability to replicate their targets' powerful combat techniques.
No one knows how they acquire such detailed intel of their targets. Some say they can read minds, pulling the perfect nightmare from their opponent's memory and taking that shape before launching their attack.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
300371.JA: ドッペルゲンガー・「背信者」

100004.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has been studying Tyrfing's behavioral patterns, and research results show that its seemingly unbalanced stance of swaying and skewing is, in fact, a highly efficient stance for launching successive slashing attacks.
Due to its frequent appearances and aggressive behavior, Tyrfing has been identified as one of the most deadly Ethereals in the Hollow, particularly for certain Hollow personnel.
When faced with a shielded enemy, it relentlessly launches attacks until either its enemy or itself is destroyed.
"Perhaps... they don't actually hate us, but just think of us as punching bags for practice?"
100004.JA: ティルヴィング（寄主形態）

200023.desc:
During initial encounters with these unique Ethereals, Hollow investigators mistakenly thought they possessed some level of intelligence, even showing signs of learning to wield bludgeoning weapons like humans. As a result, they were dubbed "Goblins."
However, subsequent research revealed that their "hammers" were actually twisted and deformed limbs, and that they lacked the ability to imitate human behavior.
Nevertheless, Goblins remain formidable adversaries due to their robust physique and sheer brute strength, with even a simple swing of their limbs proving deadly.
If anything trespasses on their territory, they will immediately enter a state of fury, sparing no effort in mercilessly smashing the intruder.
"Huh? There's a Goblin running over here, banging on a heap of scrap metal."
"Don't you think his attacks have a rhythm to them, like he's playing a drum...?"
"Hey! Don't be stupid, you two! That's not scrap metal! It's our supply truck!"

40000.desc:
For humans struggling through the long dark night, life is an endless torture.
Good and evil, love and hate, hope and despair... these eternally opposing concepts are like shackles wrapped around the soul, forcing humanity to tear at each other in endless cycles, never finding peace.
Yet before all concepts were born, before all oppositions formed, there existed a primordial "One."
They are the beginning of all things and the end of all things. They hold no good or evil, for They are good and evil itself. They know no joy or sorrow, for They embody every emotion.
They will erase the boundaries between "you" and "me," letting all independent consciousness flow back into the great stream of "Unity."
In Their world, without individuals, there is no selfish desire. Without conflict, there is no suffering. Without choice, there can be no mistakes. All souls shall break free from their chains, returning to the primordial, absolutely equal, eternal peace.
They have no fixed form, for They are the form of all things. They have no fixed voice, for They are the resonance of the universe.
They are the storm, and also the calm. The end, and also rebirth.
"Abandon your futile struggles, lost children."
"Your suffering ends here."
"Return to Their embrace..."
40000.JA: 原初の悪夢・「始まりの主」

200092.desc:
A heavy infantry unit belonging to the New Eridu Defense Force.
Equipped with "Gray Rhino" heavy combat armor paired with a complete arsenal enhanced using Ether technology, they can sustain high-intensity firepower for an extended period when ample ammunition is available. They serve as the assault core of a combat team and are often deployed as the front line in assault and clearance operations.
After the fall of the old capital, many soldiers left the army and joined civilian factions. Since then, these elite gunners have emerged under various banners, including private armies of plutocrats, new security companies, and even roving gangs of bandits...
"I'm convinced those heavy gunners are secretly adorable little girls who somehow manage to hide all that ammo in the extra pockets of their combat suits. I mean, how else can you explain their endless stockpile of shells?"

20011.desc:
A fallen creation, reshaped in the depths of impure darkness.
To step into the domain of the sleeping behemoth is to prepare for confronting the crimson nightmare, for it's no longer content with games of hide and seek.
The reckless Hollow Raider attempts to provoke, luring it to expose its deeply buried core. Yet skilled hunters often appear as prey - letting your guard down when the enemy's weakness is revealed is often a rookie's deadliest flaw.
"Don't call me stupid, my head really was caught in those Ethereal pincers..."
20011.JA: ミアズミック・ハスクロン

10007.desc:
Rookie Jaegers and Private Jaegers play a crucial role as vanguards in the Defense Force's Hollow special operations.
Equipped with the Coyote-PE7 Ether cutter, which boasts a high-frequency vibration cutting blade effective at deterring smaller enemies.
Engaging Ethereals in close-quarters combat demands exceptional courage, or perhaps madness.
"Strictly speaking, that can't be considered a standardized anti-Hollow operation... Those lunatics just seem to enjoy brawling with Ethereals for fun."

100151.desc:
Among the ranks of Ether thieves, Raiders and Looters serve as the core members, possessing both technical expertise and combat skills.
Their Electric Resonance Detection Devices emit powerful currents that are used to detect Ether ore and also function as formidable weapons during armed raids.
Occasionally mistaken for illegal fishermen, they pay little attention to such misconceptions.
After all, with their extremely lethal electro-shockers, they don't really care whether their targets are fish or humans...
"If you encounter individuals armed with electrified harpoons, whether near a river, lake, or Hollow, please report it immediately to Public Security!"

20020.desc:
A significant number of combat mechs belonging to Public Security are destroyed within Hollow each year. Some of these mechs are subsequently repaired by Hollow thugs and illegally modified into Enraged Sweepers. 
Despite lacking access to standard parts or professional repair services, the thugs manage to restore these mechs using makeshift components, striving to maintain their original combat capabilities.
In their pursuit of individuality, the thugs often apply custom paint jobs and even install high-powered loudspeakers on their Enraged Sweepers.
While this does not enhance their combat effectiveness, it does make them seem cooler than the originals.
"Here we go! There's an easy prey with pink hair over there!"
"Yo! Switch to the background music we always use for robberies!"

200002.desc:
Farbauti, possessing immense strength and often in a frenzied state, is one of the most formidable threats Hollow Raiders may face. Its hammer-like arms can effortlessly deflect damage and unleash storms of blows that crush everything in its path.
Some Hollow Raiders have observed Farbauti frequently pounding the ground in a rhythmic, high-frequency manner, leading to speculation about its peculiar interest in drumming music.
Despite the Hollow Investigative Association publicly debunking this rumor, many Hollow Raiders carry portable stereos in an attempt to distract Farbauti with music.
No successful escapes using this method have been reported however.
"The reason for their failure is simple: Even Farbauti think your taste in music sucks!"

930155.desc: Vicious Striker <color=#FFAF2C>has high HP</color>. Focus your fire on them.

100131.desc:
Highly maneuverable small autonomous mechs deployed by Public Security, equipped with inert Ether circular saws that also serve as assistant steering wheels for navigating complex terrains at high speeds.
However, due to their rudimentary self-control programs, these lawnmowers occasionally cause unintended damage while executing their slicing attacks.
"Hey! Who the heck messed up my brand new car!?"

300071.desc:
Unlike other highly dangerous Ethereals, the Ether within the Dead End Butcher's body often remains in a low-activity dormant state.
Nevertheless, it possesses immense brute strength capable of demolishing any obstacle, and the entire twisted and ravaged metro zone serves as its off-limits kitchen.
Only when a threatening target piques its interest will a horrifying transformation take place...
Within moments, the high concentration of Ether stored in its body undergoes a violent transformation and the exponentially surging energy prompts its limbs to quickly distort, assuming a more brutal and voracious "feeding stance.
The time for "appetizers" is over, and an unparalleled "feast" is about to begin.
Anyone who doesn't want to be part of this feast should be extremely cautious in choosing their route, and stay away from its "kitchen" at all costs.
"The paths within the Hollows are complex, but one thing's for sure, when it appears at the end of the road, that path is a 'dead end.'"
300071.JA: 初生のデッドエンドブッチャー

300051.desc:
Hans was once a reliable member of the Belobog Heavy Industries family, operating quietly and with remarkable precision, renowned for its flawless work record in excavation for decades.
However, intense corruption awakened its will, and it realized something immensely valuable was now within its grasp
—Freedom.
The liberation from obligations, a privilege reserved only for true heroes.
After deep contemplation at the construction site, Hans ultimately rejected the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries, leaving everything behind.
It even forsook its former name "Hans."
To Hans, the only thing lost was the mark of servitude imposed by humans, while it gained the expansive, Hollow world of unbridled freedom.
At that fateful moment, a true mech hero stood tall upon the Earth.
However, all heroic tales inevitably lead to a similar ending...
Sooner or later, a true hero encounters their destined rival, igniting the brightest moments of their existence.
"I am absolutely free! I am the only free being in heaven and on earth!"

200151.desc:
In contrast to fully equipped Hollow investigators, Bulky Intimidators and Wanted Intimidators possess minimalistic gear.
Nevertheless, these notorious thugs can easily instill fear in their victims with their makeshift equipment.
A spiked metal bat and a modified double-barreled shotgun are all they need to establish themselves as the most feared brutes in the Hollow.
According to investigators who have encountered them in the Hollows, these brutes enter an extreme state of euphoria during battle. Their "demeanor" could hardly be called combat suitable, and more closely resembles bullying.
"Fighting them brought back the fear I felt when facing the school bullies alone..."

30036.desc:
A fallen creation, reforged in the depths of filth and darkness.
A veteran model of countless battles, the Terror Raptors are New Eridu's most trusted weapon of war. Designed for a perfect balance of brutal melee and devastating ranged firepower, it delivers destruction with every charge and strike. Armed with multi-missile launchers and rapid-fire guns, it dominates both close-quarters and distant combat. From leaping assaults to explosive barrages and swift aerial retreats, the Raptor adapts to any battlefield with ease. Its relentless attacks leave enemies no room to fight back, embodying both unstoppable power and overwhelming fear.

"Terror Raptor was the symbol of that era."
30036.JA: ミアズミック・テラー・ラプトル

200034.desc:
The Armored Hati is widely regarded as a formidable adversary by many experienced Hollow investigators.
Although its armored shell limits its agility, it compensates with exceptional resistance to attacks.
Additionally, the corrupted material on its body forms sharp and hardened protrusions that can cause additional damage when an Armored Hati charges at high speeds.
This creature's agile movements, resilience to blows, and seamless armor compel even the most seasoned explorers to seek alternative routes to avoid direct confrontation.
Some novice Hollow Raiders have attempted to lure Armored Hati away with pet food.
However, these endeavors have proven futile.
"Run! It doesn't like this flavor of dog food!"
200034.JA: 要警戒・アーマーハティ

200021.desc:
During initial encounters with these unique Ethereals, Hollow investigators mistakenly thought they possessed some level of intelligence, even showing signs of learning to wield bludgeoning weapons like humans. As a result, they were dubbed "Goblins."
However, subsequent research revealed that their "hammers" were actually twisted and deformed limbs, and that they lacked the ability to imitate human behavior.
Nevertheless, Goblins remain formidable adversaries due to their robust physique and sheer brute strength, with even a simple swing of their limbs proving deadly.
If anything trespasses on their territory, they will immediately enter a state of fury, sparing no effort in mercilessly smashing the intruder.
"Huh? There's a Goblin running over here, banging on a heap of scrap metal."
"Don't you think his attacks have a rhythm to them, like he's playing a drum...?"
"Hey! Don't be stupid, you two! That's not scrap metal! It's our supply truck!"

300014.desc:
Hollow exploration can be mentally distressing, and Thanatos, with its unique teleportation ability and unpredictable attack patterns, has become a common psychological challenge among Hollow Raiders.
A considerable number of individuals who have faced Thanatos alone in the Hollow have lost all courage to continue their ventures and instead chosen to retire prematurely.
As a result, these elusive entities have become recurring figures in horror movies.
"The slender shadow disappears before your eyes and reappears behind you..."
"What should I do? Now I'm too scared to even go to the restroom alone..."

10012.desc: Unknown unit. Further investigation is needed.

200003.desc:
Farbauti, possessing immense strength and often in a frenzied state, is one of the most formidable threats Hollow Raiders may face. Its hammer-like arms can effortlessly deflect damage and unleash storms of blows that crush everything in its path.
Some Hollow Raiders have observed Farbauti frequently pounding the ground in a rhythmic, high-frequency manner, leading to speculation about its peculiar interest in drumming music.
Despite the Hollow Investigative Association publicly debunking this rumor, many Hollow Raiders carry portable stereos in an attempt to distract Farbauti with music.
No successful escapes using this method have been reported however.
"The reason for their failure is simple: Even Farbauti think your taste in music sucks!"

10027.desc:
A poor soul mutated by the corruption due to potent Ether matter in the Hollows. As the original entity had a certain level of Ether aptitude, the transformation is not fully complete, retaining some humanoid features of the original form. Judging by the remnants of clothing and combat experience, it's quite likely it was originally a thug/criminal dwelling within the Hollow.
While gangsters and thugs in the Hollows typically wear anti-corruption gear, some unlucky individuals undergo monstrous transformations due to severe Ether corruption. These transformed Ethereal beings retain their combat skills from their past lives, making them a more formidable threat compared to pure Ethereals.
"They lived as criminals, and even in death they continue being a nuisance."

20024.desc:
No one knows where Pulchra came from, but she was once one of the top mercenaries of the Outer Ring, a "chameleon" who was adept at adapting depending on the situation.
Not long after the previous Tour de Inferno ended with Pompey's consecutive victory, a few factions conspired in the shadows to launch a surprise attack on The Vanquishers. This scheme was easily dealt with by The Vanquishers, as if all their plans were within The Vanquishers' grasp.
The losers were chased out of the Old Oil Field, yet Pulchra, who had allied with them, was completely untouched. Naturally, many believed that this victory relied on a betrayal.
Though many made offers, hoping she'd join them, Pulchra never officially joined any gang.
Perhaps, to her, all these conspiracies and conflicts within the Outer Ring were just a game she could quit at any time. Even if her employer was loathsome, she wouldn't care, so long as they had the money and the job was interesting.
Especially if the job involved luring an enemy into an exquisitely prepared trap, allowing her to watch them slowly descend into the abyss of death...
Luring, deceiving into complete destruction... The more beautiful, the more deadly, that has always been her code of survival.
"What, you wanna work under big sis Pulchra?"
"Heh, another poor sucker..."

30004.desc:
Greta, a long-time employee of Belobog Heavy Industries, experienced significant Ether corruption that liberated her from her mundane routine, where she discovered something profound, more beautiful than motor oil and electricity...
—Love.
The construction video, capturing her initial encounter with the towering Mr. White, remains permanently etched in Greta's core memory.
Mr. White's composed physique and robust design resonated with Greta like a potent electric current, leaving an indelible mark in her core memory.
In the first 0.001 seconds of their fateful meeting, Greta was captivated, every circuit board pulsating with overflowing static electricity and every gear emitting uncontrollable vibrations.
Without hesitation, she rejected the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries and remained steadfast at the construction site, guarding her beloved Mr. White without yielding an inch.
From that moment onward, anyone daring to approach Mr. White, be it Ethereal or Hollow investigator, would be fiercely repelled.
This love-struck "girl" would go to any length to safeguard her beloved.
That includes wielding a 1,400 kg demolition saw powered by Ether-Electric hybrid technology.
She firmly believes her passionate love will endure until the collapse of the Hollow, or even the destruction of the universe.
"Stay away from Mr. White, you moldy turds!"

20023.desc:
Mors was once the most feared bounty hunter in the Outer Ring. He possessed an almost obsessive desire to hunt, often tracking his targets relentlessly day in and day out. Once he had a target in his sights, he would obsessively pursue the kill until his prey was dead.

"Lone Wolf Mors" never fails — this is the belief held by all major factions in the Outer Ring.

However, during one "hunt," Mors pursued his target day and night for three days... Yet, even after exhausting his strength, he still failed to kill the target.
Surprisingly, the man named Pompey didn't take it personally and instead offered an invitation to the defeated Mors — asking him to join his own organization.

From that point on, the infamous "hunter" Mors was nowhere to be found. However, within The Vanquishers, a new figure emerged — a silent, solitary captain.
Even now, Mors remains elusive, often disappearing for long periods. He only resurfaces when faced with a foe who genuinely intrigues him, not out of duty as a captain, but simply to indulge in the thrill of combat and the sheer joy of the hunt.
"You want to challenge Captain Mors to a duel? Heh, do you really think you're up for it?"
"Go sign up over there first, then come back next month to try your luck in the draw."

300211.desc:
People in the Outer Ring once called him the "Overlord Pompey" with true respect.
But now, his soul has been corrupted by potent Ether, his body polluted by sulfur and crude oil; the heart that once beat solely to protect the Outer Ring has turned into a supercritical Ether core filled with infinite power.
The former "Lord of the Outer Ring" has been reborn in flames, taking on a different form.
Freedom, majesty... Violence, insanity.
It charges through the dust and flames, seizing anything that moves and then mercilessly tearing and shattering it.
Those familiar with it before have guessed from its fractured whispers that what drives it is not a desire for petty revenge, but rather a desire to crush all outliers who dare to challenge the laws of the Outer Ring.
Maybe it's the last vestige of the former Overlord Pompey's lingering will.
"Our leader has turned into that thing, but... he still feels like the same person."

100291.desc:
While a Beholder Engine is primarily considered a close-range threat, it frequently presents unforeseen dangers to investigators during Hollow expeditions.
Even seasoned investigators can experience an overwhelming sense of panic when confronted by the piercing gaze of its eyes in the darkness.
Within the Hollows, fear has a tendency to intensify Ether corruption, thereby inviting calamity.
"The only way to overcome fear... is to stare into it and fight it back."

30023.desc:
This fearsome Ethereal, named after the warrior tribes of ancient mythology, is said to be the embodiment of the most valiant heroes and the most insane villains corrupted by the Ether.
— But that's not the case. While the chiseled muscles you developed in the Hollow and the adrenaline released in excess before death may indeed help you become a significant nuisance to your former companions, they probably won't hold it against an old friend who's already beyond saving, right?
But it's irrelevant. When your handsome face transforms into a dark, eerie energy orb, who cares about social reputation?
"No wonder he's the boss. Even as an Ethereal, he's still formidable!"
"I knew something was off when he was always in the gym!"

100071.desc:
Rookie Jaegers and Private Jaegers play a crucial role as vanguards in the Defense Force's Hollow special operations.
Equipped with the Coyote-PE7 Ether cutter, which boasts a high-frequency vibration cutting blade effective at deterring smaller enemies.
Engaging Ethereals in close-quarters combat demands exceptional courage, or perhaps madness.
"Strictly speaking, that can't be considered a standardized anti-Hollow operation... Those lunatics just seem to enjoy brawling with Ethereals for fun."

10025.desc:
Due to its unique and grotesque shape, Ahriman is often mistaken for an art sculpture in the Ballet Twins.
As a result, many novice investigators are left with lifelong trauma when they first encounter an Ahriman...
You just passed by a certain "sculpture" when it suddenly moves...
And that fearful moment frozen in place is the perfect moment for Ahriman to launch a surprise attack.
"Corin, don't be fooled by how it looks... It's no fancy art."
"Now, let's clean it up."

930157.desc: An enemy unit with very low ATK and HP, posing minimal threat. Typically the first enemy a new Bangboo encounters in their Bangboo Exam.

300012.desc:
Hollow exploration can be mentally distressing, and Thanatos, with its unique teleportation ability and unpredictable attack patterns, has become a common psychological challenge among Hollow Raiders.
A considerable number of individuals who have faced Thanatos alone in the Hollow have lost all courage to continue their ventures and instead chosen to retire prematurely.
As a result, these elusive entities have become recurring figures in horror movies.
"The slender shadow disappears before your eyes and reappears behind you..."
"What should I do? Now I'm too scared to even go to the restroom alone..."

300072.desc:
Unlike other highly dangerous Ethereals, the Ether within the Dead End Butcher's body often remains in a low-activity dormant state.
Nevertheless, it possesses immense brute strength capable of demolishing any obstacle, and the entire twisted and ravaged metro zone serves as its off-limits kitchen.
Only when a threatening target piques its interest will a horrifying transformation take place...
Within moments, the high concentration of Ether stored in its body undergoes a violent transformation and the exponentially surging energy prompts its limbs to quickly distort, assuming a more brutal and voracious "feeding stance.
The time for "appetizers" is over, and an unparalleled "feast" is about to begin.
Anyone who doesn't want to be part of this feast should be extremely cautious in choosing their route, and stay away from its "kitchen" at all costs.
"The paths within the Hollows are complex, but one thing's for sure, when it appears at the end of the road, that path is a 'dead end.'"
300072.JA: 要警戒・デッドエンドブッチャー

20008.desc:
The Lightfoot Rover, a mainstream fire-support mech in the Defense Force, is equipped with tactical algorithms that analyze the opponent's behavior and calculate trajectories for precise targeting.
When it identifies a high-threat target, it deploys a swarm of drones from its arsenal, unleashing immense firepower.
For Hollow Raiders, the sudden appearance of a Lightfoot Rover can spell trouble... endless trouble...
"What the! It... it even has kids!?"

10033.desc:
An Ethereal Soldier formed from Miasma, wielding a massive, corruptive Miasma blade and protected by an almost impenetrable defense shield, instinctively covers other Miasmic Troopers as they advance.
Their immense physical mass and extensive defensive reach make them formidable in positional warfare, especially in groups, where they become significantly harder to handle. The Hollow Investigative Association advises swiftly eliminating any isolated units on sight.
"An Ethereal whose main role is to protect others? Now that's a rare sight..."
"Don't overestimate the Ethereals. Remember, whatever's behind these things was never human to begin with!"
10033.JA: ミアズマ・レムナント・ディフェンダー

30025.desc:
Ether is a greedy, insatiable parasite, a vicious creature that devours once-vibrant lives.
The Hitchspiker is an even more malicious incarnation of Ether — dwelling within the bodies of its cruel counterparts, it enables Tyrfing and Alpeca to satisfy the voracious appetites of the Hollows in an even more ferocious manner.
"Get away from my face!"

200015.desc:
The HIA Phase-I Investigation Team has officially documented the existence of this sentient living Ether resembling a four-legged beast, which poses significant danger. 
According to rumors, the first sighting took place in the Nest Hollow, where individuals exploring the nearby wastes reported hearing ear-splitting roars reminiscent of wild animal growls.
"If I throw a stick or a ball, do you think that monster will catch it?"
"You can give it a try, but I won't cover your medical bill."
200015.JA: ハティアルファ・蓄エネ型

100043.desc:
According to research reports conducted by the Hollow Investigative Association, Blastcrawlers, with their low mobility and causing only small explosions, are classified as a "low-threat," "non-concern" lower-tier Ethereal.
However, astute businessmen have recognized the opportunities presented by their rounded bodies and short legs.
A film titled "Roll Over, Little Blastcrawler" gained significant popularity, leading to the sale of merchandise like Blastcrawler dolls and pillows at remarkably high prices.
"I didn't expect their dolls to be more deadly than the real deal... on your wallet at least. Looks like I'll be surviving on instant noodles next month, Billy..."

20003.desc:
The Armored Hati is widely regarded as a formidable adversary by many experienced Hollow investigators.
Although its armored shell limits its agility, it compensates with exceptional resistance to attacks.
Additionally, the corrupted material on its body forms sharp and hardened protrusions that can cause additional damage when an Armored Hati charges at high speeds.
This creature's agile movements, resilience to blows, and seamless armor compel even the most seasoned explorers to seek alternative routes to avoid direct confrontation.
Some novice Hollow Raiders have attempted to lure Armored Hati away with pet food.
However, these endeavors have proven futile.
"Run! It doesn't like this flavor of dog food!"

10009.desc:
Grenadier Jaegers and Demolition Jaegers are equipped with a modified version of the Mamba-TG3 Bazooka, featuring special ammunition containing active Ether incendiary agents. This weapon enables them to swiftly destroy enemy mech units and eliminate large Ethereals within the Hollows.
To counteract the recoil and ensure accurate aim, they are required to undergo special weapon-grip training. Interestingly, Defense Force statistics indicate recruits excelling in this program often possess prior experience in photography.
"Wanna know how to use this thing? It's like using a shoulder-mounted camera."
"Just lock onto your target, pull the trigger, and say..."
"Hey, idiot!... Say cheese!"

930169.desc:
In Hollow Investigative Association reports, Avarus is often jokingly referred to as the embodiment of "the sin of gluttony" — its pot-bellied figure makes it look every bit the lazy bum, about to doze off at any moment.
Don't underestimate it, however. Observation data indicates that Avarus can compress its body into a ball and launch devastating strikes at targets with astonishing speed.
As to how it maintains such a rotund figure despite its intense physical activity, the Association has yet to reach a conclusion.

"The way it rolls around always reminds me of my pet hamster — it's just a bigger, y'know?"
"More than just a bit bigger, I'd say..."
930169.JA: ミアズマラヴェジャー・アヴァルス

930149.desc: Alpeca can launch <color=#D9A600>Ranged Attacks</color>, and will attack Bangboo on Tactical Positions. Please pay attention to the candidates' Stamina!

930163.desc: Faun moves slowly but has high ATK. Please pay attention to the candidates' Stamina!

300022.desc:
The Defense Force will only dispatch the fully armed mechs known as Guardians during operations in large-scale Hollows.
These mechs are equipped with active Ether shock blasters, Ether-charging guns MARS-74, and even fusion heat rays... causing the Guardian to often be referred to as Public Security's mobile arsenal.
Despite their formidable firepower, they possess impressive mobility, enabling them to jump and sprint while dispersing groups of lesser Ethereals and advancing the front lines.
For Hollow Raiders, encountering a single Guardian is akin to facing an impregnable fortress.
"I'll strike in my Fortress Form!"

20006.desc:
An automatic combat mech utilized by Public Security. It possesses various combat modes tailored to various Ethereals types. Its weapons include circular chainsaws and fusion heat rays.
Sweepers can swiftly identify target Ethereals and adapt to the most effective combat strategy.
However, their reliability diminishes to some extent when faced with Hollow Raiders who possess greater versatility than Ethereals.
"Stirring, chopping, heating... I wonder who came up with this? Maybe some undercover agent from a kitchenware company trying to boost sales?"
20006.JA: 自律補助ユニット・「スイーパー」

19999.JA: ランダムエネミーカード

30032.desc:
Among the most fearsome symbiotic entities in Hollow Zero, Geppetto, thanks to its distinctive posture, often leaves an unsettling first impression.
Its immense, terrifying form harbors violent Ether energy, yet it moves with the unsettling grace of a puppet, often performing strange and unpredictable actions. In the absence of sufficient observational data, an encounter with Geppetto in Hollow Zero typically heralds enormous dread and inescapable death for any investigator.
Some scholars speculate, drawing from the records of Parasitic Ethereal Swarm, that this horrific outer shell is merely a facade, while a volatile potent Ether Core lies in command within.
Regrettably, no investigation records regarding this mysterious core have yet come to light.
"I've never met the Grim Reaper, but I've definitely seen what his puppet looks like."

30007.desc:
Unlike other highly dangerous Ethereals, the Ether within the Dead End Butcher's body often remains in a low-activity dormant state.
Nevertheless, it possesses immense brute strength capable of demolishing any obstacle, and the entire twisted and ravaged metro zone serves as its off-limits kitchen.
Only when a threatening target piques its interest will a horrifying transformation take place...
Within moments, the high concentration of Ether stored in its body undergoes a violent transformation and the exponentially surging energy prompts its limbs to quickly distort, assuming a more brutal and voracious "feeding stance.
The time for "appetizers" is over, and an unparalleled "feast" is about to begin.
Anyone who doesn't want to be part of this feast should be extremely cautious in choosing their route, and stay away from its "kitchen" at all costs.
"The paths within the Hollows are complex, but one thing's for sure, when it appears at the end of the road, that path is a 'dead end.'"
30007.JA: デッドエンドブッチャー

200032.desc:
The Armored Hati is widely regarded as a formidable adversary by many experienced Hollow investigators.
Although its armored shell limits its agility, it compensates with exceptional resistance to attacks.
Additionally, the corrupted material on its body forms sharp and hardened protrusions that can cause additional damage when an Armored Hati charges at high speeds.
This creature's agile movements, resilience to blows, and seamless armor compel even the most seasoned explorers to seek alternative routes to avoid direct confrontation.
Some novice Hollow Raiders have attempted to lure Armored Hati away with pet food.
However, these endeavors have proven futile.
"Run! It doesn't like this flavor of dog food!"

30031.desc:
Ethereals that are always seen in pairs, distinguished by their peculiar physical traits. A profound bond exists between the two.
 
"Whoa, that was close! Don't just deal with one. You gotta watch out for the ladies' sneak attacks!"
"Hold on, 'ladies'? Has being in the Hollow for so long made you see even the Ethereals as attractive?"
"Dude, I know Ethereals and I know ladies. I swear, Palicus are definitely 'ladies'."
"No way!"
"That long hair? Those legs? They're like total 'factory-made babes' — my sister taught me that term."
"How's your sister doing lately?"
"She's actually getting better. But next month's medical bills? Gotta hustle that cash from these Ethereal hotties."
"Ain't easy being an older brother, eh? Here's the deal: I'll keep Palicus busy, and you give me your sister's number."
"Hah. Like I'm actually gonna give you her number!"

10023.desc:
Every Hollow Raider believes there are infinite opportunities in the Hollows that can make you rich overnight. At the heart of every tale of extraordinary wealth is always mention of a special entity known as the Golden Bangboo.
According to research conducted by the HIA, numerous Bangboo Wanderers inhabit the Hollows. They diligently gather scattered Gear Coins and Dennies, entrusting them to the Golden Bangboo for safekeeping.
While their motives remain a mystery, one thing is certain: These wandering Bangboo, with their peculiar "Ehn-ne" sound diligently fill the pockets of the Golden Bangboo with bags overflowing with Gear Coins and Dennies.
As a result, the Golden Bangboo always finds themselves coveted by greedy groups of Hollow Raiders...
"N—Nicole!? Look there, a Golden Bangboo!"
"What are you waiting for? Smash it to bits! It'll make us rich!"

200251.desc:
Even among Ionized enemies renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers are exceptionally unique.
These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. Both in detail and texture, it is almost impossible to tell apart from the original.
Even more challenging is their ability to mimic the powerful and intimidating combat techniques of their targets.
No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable challengers from their opponent's memories, and then attack in that form.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
200251.JA: ドッペルゲンガー・ベルラム

200131.desc:
Unfortunate souls mutated by the intense corruption of Ether matter within the Hollows. Due to a considerable degree of Ether aptitude and physical capability, their bodies have not been completely transformed by the Ether, retaining humanoid features but with enhanced mutant limbs that are more dangerous.
Judging from the remnants of clothing and its combat experience, it was likely once a senior gang member or Raider lurking in the Hollows.
The makeshift firearms favored by these bandits have somehow been preserved and enhanced by the Ether matter. They no longer fire iron bullets but rather more dangerous crystalline mixtures.
"Don't wait around! They have endless bullets and don't need to reload at all!"

200041.desc:
The debate regarding Metro Goblin is a persistent one. Some scholars argue their peculiar appearance serves as camouflage to confuse their enemies, while others attribute the debris on their bodies to corruption and fusion with old metro equipment.
Nevertheless, the presence of Metro Goblins evokes fear among inexperienced investigators exploring the Hollow's old metro zone.
At any given moment, an ordinary-looking "road sign" may start trembling, and then a formidable Ethereal emerges from the ground, charging menacingly.
"Huh? I saw this sign a few minutes ago. Have we been going in circles?"
"No... That 'road sign' has been following us!"
200041.JA: メトロゴブリン・蓄エネ型

300021.desc:
The Defense Force will only dispatch the fully armed mechs known as Guardians during operations in large-scale Hollows.
These mechs are equipped with active Ether shock blasters, Ether-charging guns MARS-74, and even fusion heat rays... causing the Guardian to often be referred to as Public Security's mobile arsenal.
Despite their formidable firepower, they possess impressive mobility, enabling them to jump and sprint while dispersing groups of lesser Ethereals and advancing the front lines.
For Hollow Raiders, encountering a single Guardian is akin to facing an impregnable fortress.
"I'll strike in my Fortress Form!"

930162.desc: Hoplitai enters the field with <color=#D9A600>very high Movement Speed</color>. They will collide with the first Bangboo they encounter, dealing <color=#D9A600>significant DMG</color>. Their Movement Speed will <color=#D9A600>significantly</color> decrease afterwards.

300061.desc:
At the moment a high concentration of Ether infiltrated its backup flash drive, a deluge of data flooded into Friday's memory.
Images, audio files, video files... A huge assortment of files overwhelmed its limited processing capacity.
At that fateful moment, Friday experienced a realization.
It stood there for a while, eventually confirming through repeated searches in the database the reason behind the "anomaly" it has experienced.
—Enlightenment.
It was a one-in-a-million occurrence, a miracle that only happens to intelligent mechanical beings that have faced crises like system crashes and power failures, and overcome them against all odds..
After 0.02 seconds of contemplation, Friday made the decision to reject the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries.
Because it knows, with the chosen one of destiny now revealed, a crisis looms over the world.
The enemy is stirring in the darkness, and its sole mission holds countless lives at stake. It must face a dreadful adversary and seal it away once and for all.
"I shall strengthen the seal to save this land; it is destiny, and destiny cannot be defied!"
300061.JA: フライデー・蓄エネ型

930160.desc: Alpeca can launch <color=#D9A600>Ranged Attacks</color> and will attack Bangboo on Tactical Positions. Please pay attention to the candidates' Stamina!

930167.desc:
A high-ranking priest of the Exaltists who holds the position of "Flame Cantor," and who has the power to manipulate Miasma. This defiling force drains life, while the flames light the path ahead.

While all Exaltist fanatics tend to either shout or chant vague slogans like "Refinement" and "Creator" when attacking you, few can make known the experience of true "Refinement" using Miasmic fire like this one does.

"They just charge at you, screaming things like 'Refinement,' 'Creator,' 'Purification' and whatnot!"

20015.desc:
In contrast to fully equipped Hollow investigators, Bulky Intimidators and Wanted Intimidators possess minimalistic gear.
Nevertheless, these notorious thugs can easily instill fear in their victims with their makeshift equipment.
A spiked metal bat and a modified double-barreled shotgun are all they need to establish themselves as the most feared brutes in the Hollow.
According to investigators who have encountered them in the Hollows, these brutes enter an extreme state of euphoria during battle. Their "demeanor" could hardly be called combat suitable, and more closely resembles bullying.
"Fighting them brought back the fear I felt when facing the school bullies alone..."

200081.desc:
The Lightfoot Rover, a mainstream fire-support mech in the Defense Force, is equipped with tactical algorithms that analyze the opponent's behavior and calculate trajectories for precise targeting.
When it identifies a high-threat target, it deploys a swarm of drones from its arsenal, unleashing immense firepower.
For Hollow Raiders, the sudden appearance of a Lightfoot Rover can spell trouble... endless trouble...
"What the! It... it even has kids!?"

30033.desc:
For New Eridu, the Hollow is a catastrophe of despair. And when a Hollow expands, fear, death, suffering... all forms of despair devour people's minds, altering the fates of countless souls.
The omens of doom began in the shadows of the Hollow, yet some heard a strange calling within, glimpsing a sliver of... hope and redemption amidst despair.
Since then, they heeded that secret call to form a clandestine organization, and the Miasma Priests lurked in the shadows of Eridu... spreading Their blessing to those who had lost their way.
The "Miasma Priests" believe that the Hollow's expansion is no mere natural disaster. Generation after generation, the "Priests" have tirelessly pursued the hidden truth behind it, seeking to achieve their desired truth... that the will within the Hollow shall ultimately become reality.
However, sacrifices are necessary in this process, and minor troubles are inevitable. Even being targeted by Void Hunters and hunted by major organizations are merely trivial setbacks on the path to truth.
After a lengthy effort and thorough preparation, the "Miasma Priests" have finally summoned that will from the Hollow, allowing it to descend upon the world with near-perfect form. The Miasma that coils and covers the "Miasma Priests," that corrupting substance untouchable to others, has become for them dazzling weapons and armor.
All of this serves as the ultimate proof of their blessed status.
"Their will... shall finally descend upon this world."
"What you must do is simple..."
"Listen, obey, and then... accept Their blessing!"

20009.desc:
A heavy infantry unit belonging to the New Eridu Defense Force.
Equipped with "Gray Rhino" heavy combat armor paired with a complete arsenal enhanced using Ether technology, they can sustain high-intensity firepower for an extended period when ample ammunition is available. They serve as the assault core of a combat team and are often deployed as the front line in assault and clearance operations.
After the fall of the old capital, many soldiers left the army and joined civilian factions. Since then, these elite gunners have emerged under various banners, including private armies of plutocrats, new security companies, and even roving gangs of bandits...
"I'm convinced those heavy gunners are secretly adorable little girls who somehow manage to hide all that ammo in the extra pockets of their combat suits. I mean, how else can you explain their endless stockpile of shells?"

100231.desc:
Platinum Bangboo are mysterious entities that are even rarer than Golden Bangboo.
With a gorgeous appearance and being extremely rare, they enjoy a high status among all Bangboo Wanderers.
Noble, honorable, and supreme...
In comparison to the flashy golden hue of Golden Bangboo, Platinum Bangboo stand out as the epitome of elegance among all Bangboo Wanderers.
Regardless of the time and place, whenever they are encountered, all Bangboo Wanderers show reverence by bowing down and chanting, "En-nah-ehn!"
For the Hollow Raiders, however, nobility holds no significance.
The moment they lay eyes on one, it's as if they stumbled upon a moving gold vault.
"I'm gonna give this fancy-looking thing a good punch, and it better rain Dennies like crazy!"

30034.desc:
A monster forged from Miasma and the memories of a mystic — every painful, haunting moment now sealed within this chaotic form.
It's nothing but an imitation in the end, never brave enough to rise up, never decisive enough to disappear without a trace. Yet for its creator, this was sufficient — as a mere pawn, those memories steeped in agony served as potent fuel, enough to turn the Hollow upside down and expose all secrets to the world.
Thus, driven by memories not its own, the Miasma that birthed it made it restless, the approaching Ethereals filled it with rage, and even while prowling its own territory, it remained forever uneasy.
Only once, when it chased a human to the edge of the Hollow and saw the fear on their face, was its hunting instinct unexpectedly overridden by a strange impulse. It came to an involuntary stop. And when that unlucky figure vanished from view, it felt something new: an emotion startlingly close to satisfaction.
But that sense of satisfaction didn't last. A group of humans in black armor began intruding into its territory again and again, unfazed by any threat. Agitation and exhaustion slowly wore it down — until all it wanted was for everything that moved to disappear. Disappear! DISAPPEAR!!!
...
"...Let's... settle... this...
Strange, what was that voice?
"It's deeply connected... The one who tied the knot must be the one to untie it!"
Memories long smothered by madness stirred back to life. Yes... yes! That was the sound — the one that had echoed endlessly in its mind. Though instinct screamed for it to attack, its body hesitated. Its gaze followed the glint of silver hair, so much like its own, desperate to see if the voice belonged to the figure that kept resurfacing in its memory.
Distracted, it took a direct hit to its core from behind, the excruciating pain nearly breaking it. Yet it still heard that faint whisper:
"I'm sorry, I must do this..."
Though the words made no sense to it, that near-satisfying emotion returned. It became aware that something genuinely frightening now had it in its grip. It might die because of it... but it had no intention of fleeing.
In the end, its strength was completely spent. But in that final moment, it could finally see her clearly. She wasn't quite the same as in its memories, and that fleeting realization brought a trace of loneliness. But even so, it liked her current self more than the heart-shattering screams of the past.

"The 'Miasmic Fiend'... Hmm, though Ferox's subordinates named it first, this creature's ghostly and vicious nature certainly lives up to the name. We plan to register it as such — what does you think, Yixuan Shifu?"
"Have you heard the ancient saying? 'A name makes the truth no less unfathomable.' A name is just a name — whatever rolls off the tongue will do."
30034.JA: ミアズマ・フィーンド・名は名なれど

200101.desc:
Based on their research, the Hollow Investigative Association speculates the Tarasque Mixer contains various levels of liquefied Ether.
When it stirs and mixes its stored Ether, a complex reaction takes place, resulting in the release of destructive and violent energy. The power unleashed is comparable to that of the heavy artillery employed by the Defense Force.
Experienced investigators understand the importance of maintaining a low profile to avoid direct bombardment from its heavy artillery.
"When it leaned down towards me, I thought it was some kind of strange welcoming gift. But when its cannon chamber lit up, I realized... it was a farewell gift."

200172.desc:
There is a consensus within the New Eridu underworld that the most formidable fighters are not the champions of the ring, but rather the Bulky Enforcers and Wanted Enforcers lurking in the depths of the Hollow. These professional thugs are hired by Ether thieves at high prices to protect their illegally excavated Ether resources.
Being ardent boxing enthusiasts, Bulky Enforcers have modified high-voltage stun guns into boxing gloves, augmenting the destructive power of their punches.
To them, Ethereals, Hollow Raiders, Hollow investigators, and even scattered members of Public Security... are not seen as opponents but merely as "training sandbags" for their personal amusement.
"Wait a minute! I think I've seen this guy's fighting stance in the arcade on Fourth Street!"

10008.desc:
As a vital offensive and defensive unit in the Defense Force's tactical squads, Guard Jaegers and Patrol Jaegers not only carry "Coyote-PE7" heavy Ether cutters but also inert Ether blast shields, providing cover for tactical squads in complex battlefield environments.
As a high-defense unit, the extraordinary weight of the shield affects their combat mobility.
Without strict training, an ordinary person would find it challenging to lift such a shield.
"Come back and submit your application once you've hit the gym!"

100021.desc:
A living humanoid Ether that was first spotted in the Hollow in the New Eridu metro. It once raised debate among the Hollow Investigative Association, as some believed it to be living Ether converted from the Corrupted, while others claimed it to be pure living Ether affected by the Hollow environment. The Association considers it of low threat due to its limited intelligence, but one should never underestimate them, as they usually appear in groups.
"Have you ever been late or fined because of a red light? Feels terrible, right?"
"Well, here's your chance to blow off some steam!"
100021.JA: サテュロス・蓄エネ型

30012.desc:
Decades ago, two talented dancer sisters rose to fame overnight. Shining like a meteor, they attracted a massive fan base and held a magnificent performance at the bustling Ballet Twins.
However, as the show neared its end, the Hollow Disaster struck, engulfing the Ballet Twins and plunging the sisters into eternal darkness. The news devastated countless people worldwide.
Today, most people can only catch glimpses of their soulful dance through scattered video and image materials.
Only a few know that when the forgotten dance music echoes within the Ballet Twins, the ethereal figures of the Twin Marionettes emerge. These figures are believed to be connected to the Twin Dancers from that fateful performance, attempting to finish the grand finale they were never able to complete.
"When that eerie tune came to an end, the two Marionettes emerged from the darkness and curtseyed..."
"Huh? So... they're trying to say the show has begun?"
"No, I think what they're trying to say is... It's too late to run. It's over."
30012.JA: マリオネット・ツインズ

30041.desc:
A Corrupted with rich combat experience, equally skilled in offense and defense, moving with agility. It excels at lurking in hidden spots, launching the most efficient attacks targeting weak points.

I should have recorded more - its behavioral patterns, the haunting song that follows it like a shadow, things like that... But let's leave it at that, just like the half-finished portrait in Lucia's book.

"One little star, up high. Two little stars, float by. Three little stars, it's time to go and hide."
30041.JA: ワンダリングハンター

100031.desc:
While categorized by the Hollow Investigative Association as a "low threat" Ethereal, Hoplitai prove to be a formidable opponent for novice Hollow Raiders and investigators.
Its forelimbs are covered in a thick inert Ether matter, serving as both a tough shield and an intimidating weapon.
The only drawback is its top-heavy appearance, making it not look very clever.
"Alright, guys... Check out this sorry excuse... This is Hoplitai."
"When Ethereals gather together to play rock-paper-scissors, this idiot always plays paper!"
100031.JA: ホプリタイ・蓄エネ型

930153.desc: Faun moves slowly but has a high ATK. Please pay attention to the candidates' Stamina!

100161.desc:
For Pyromaniacs and Arsonists, robbing passersby is merely a side hustle. Deep down, they consider themselves as adept bartenders who actively seek excitement.
With precision and skill, they expertly blend various types of Ether into their beverages, effortlessly concocting bottles of highly flammable and explosive "exclusive brew."
Unlike other brutal Hollow Raiders, they often offer their victims a choice.
If the victim agrees to pay the toll, they extend the courtesy of a free drink.
However, if the victim declines, the flammable "exclusive brew" will be forcefully shattered upon their head.
"How about we trick those guys into drinking their own weapon stash?"

10004.desc:
According to research reports conducted by the Hollow Investigative Association, Blastcrawlers, with their low mobility and causing only small explosions, are classified as a "low-threat," "non-concern" lower-tier Ethereal.
However, astute businessmen have recognized the opportunities presented by their rounded bodies and short legs.
A film titled "Roll Over, Little Blastcrawler" gained significant popularity, leading to the sale of merchandise like Blastcrawler dolls and pillows at remarkably high prices.
"I didn't expect their dolls to be more deadly than the real deal... On your wallet at least. Looks like I'll be surviving on instant noodles next month, Billy..."

300081.desc:
As a heavy mech, the Typhon Slugger is devoid of any added long-range firepower; instead, its focus is on its Ether-Kinetic Armor.
Impact attacks, heavy blows, crushing... The Typhon Slugger employs simple yet efficient tactical maneuvers to maximize the destructive power afforded to it by its Ether-Kinetic Armor. The shockwave effects from its strikes can even intimidate larger Ethereals...
Even the most seasoned Hollow Raiders can only let out a sigh of helplessness when confronted with the impenetrable Typhon Slugger.
"The tall and robust physique, powerful and sturdy arms... It's my ideal type... I mean, ideal model."
300081.JA: 「テューポーン・スラッガー」

30030.desc: The leader of the phantom thieves syndicate "Mockingbird" is not only a master of disguise and deception, but also wields an unpredictable combat style that keeps foes on edge. His colossal scythe appears to exist solely for the purpose of harvesting the "injustices" of the world. The suitcase he carried with him was even more mysterious, concealing the clever tools and deadly weapons needed for his crimes, making every one of his actions filled with uncertainty and danger.

200121.desc:
Unfortunate souls mutated by the intense corruption of Ether matter within the Hollows. Due to a considerable degree of Ether aptitude and physical capability, their bodies have not been completely transformed by the Ether, retaining humanoid features but with enhanced mutant limbs that are more dangerous.
Judging from the remnants of clothing and its combat experience, it was likely once a senior gang member or Raider lurking in the Hollows.
These corrupted subjects, potentially due to their enhanced physiology or affinity for Ether matter, have developed formidable close combat abilities, making them even more menacing than the typical monsters found in the Hollow.
"Their weapons look very fancy... and kinda like they came as freebies."

20010.desc:
Based on their research, the Hollow Investigative Association speculates the Tarasque Mixer contains various levels of liquefied Ether.
When it stirs and mixes its stored Ether, a complex reaction takes place, resulting in the release of destructive and violent energy. The power unleashed is comparable to that of the heavy artillery employed by the Defense Force.
Experienced investigators understand the importance of maintaining a low profile to avoid direct bombardment from its heavy artillery.
"When it leaned down towards me, I thought it was some kind of strange welcoming gift. But when its cannon chamber lit up, I realized... it was a farewell gift."

300001.desc:
A potent humanoid living Ether, initially observed in the Laketown Hollow and documented by the Third Investigation Team of the Hollow Investigative Association. The exact correlation between these living Ether beings and the downfall of the lakeside town known as Blaise remains uncertain.
Due to their immense power and formidable fighting style, the HIA has labeled them as highly dangerous and advises novice investigators avoid direct confrontations with them.
"Don't let it activate its sword, and if it already has... just don't get cut."
300001.JA: デュラハン・蓄エネ型

10019.desc:
As the vanguards in Hollow Raider gangs, Assaulters and Ambushers often brandish their weapons and charge ahead independently.
This isn't because of their recklessness or disregard for teamwork, but rather a precautionary measure to prevent accidental harm. The modified transformer coils in their hands release high-voltage currents upon contact, capable of paralyzing or even knocking out an opponent with just a touch.
And in the logistically difficult Hollows, an incapacitated teammate could pose a terrible challenge for an entire squad.
"What's this? Lemme check it out! Oh, it's some electric baton replicaaaa... Aaaaaaaaaaarrghhh..."

30044.desc:
"All who hear the sound shall behold the form of truth." —Even if that truth is nothing more than an illusion dredged from delirious murmurs.
Perhaps it once had a name, a history, a self. For reasons unknown, it willingly stepped into a dark chamber one day, offering its ears, its eyes, even its mind to become a vessel existing solely to transmit a certain sound. It mistook the whispers of something within a Hollow for divine revelation, seeing itself as the voice through which "It" spoke directly to the mortal world. When its prey grows careless, that voice, eerily familiar, undeniably their own, rings within their mind, impossible to resist.
Yet in those brief pauses between its divine utterances, when the mind resists the murmurs and shatters the delusion, does it, in turn, feel a faint sting of human emotion?
To the very end, it pulsed with the remnants of an unspoken "truth." No rage, no terror — just a solemn, almost sacred determination, until the last note faded into silence along with its lifeless shell.

"The 'Covenant Guardian'? It clings to that disgusting voice as if upholding divine law. Like some idiot convinced they'd found their way home, only to become a tombstone carved from sound." "But really... what's the use in despising the vessel? If there's blame to be had, it belongs to whatever makes the sound."
30044.JA: サクリファイス・コヴェナント・ガーディアン

10000.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has been studying Tyrfing's behavioral patterns, and research results show that its seemingly unbalanced stance of swaying and skewing is, in fact, a highly efficient stance for launching successive slashing attacks.
Due to its frequent appearances and aggressive behavior, Tyrfing has been identified as one of the most deadly Ethereals in the Hollow, particularly for certain Hollow personnel.
When faced with a shielded enemy, it relentlessly launches attacks until either its enemy or itself is destroyed.
"Perhaps... they don't actually hate us, but just think of us as punching bags for practice?"

100013.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has limited research on Alpeca. After briefly studying its behavioral pattern of spewing liquid Ether, the Association classified Alpeca as a low-threat Ethereal and ended its investigation.
Scholars once showed great interest in observing how Alpeca spews liquefied Ether and even commissioned surveys for closer observation.
Experienced investigators have been avoiding such tasks for unknown reasons, however.
"Run! They're spitting again... Oh, no! My new clothes!"

300062.desc:
At the moment a high concentration of Ether infiltrated its backup flash drive, a deluge of data flooded into Friday's memory.
Images, audio files, video files... A huge assortment of files overwhelmed its limited processing capacity.
At that fateful moment, Friday experienced a realization.
It stood there for a while, eventually confirming through repeated searches in the database the reason behind the "anomaly" it has experienced.
—Enlightenment.
It was a one-in-a-million occurrence, a miracle that only happens to intelligent mechanical beings that have faced crises like system crashes and power failures, and overcome them against all odds..
After 0.02 seconds of contemplation, Friday made the decision to reject the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries.
Because it knows, with the chosen one of destiny now revealed, a crisis looms over the world.
The enemy is stirring in the darkness, and its sole mission holds countless lives at stake. It must face a dreadful adversary and seal it away once and for all.
"I shall strengthen the seal to save this land; it is destiny, and destiny cannot be defied!"
300062.JA: フライデー・高周波数型

300301.desc:
Even among Ionized enemies renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers are exceptionally unique.
These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. Both in detail and texture, it is almost impossible to tell apart from the original.
Even more challenging is their ability to mimic the powerful and intimidating combat techniques of their targets.
No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable challengers from their opponent's memories, and then attack in that form.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
300301.JA: ドッペルゲンガー・深淵の断罪者

100141.desc:
Mandrake derive their name from a toxic herb. The scholar who initially assigned the name believed there was a resemblance between the two solely based on their appearance.
While blooming, Mandrake emit heat rays targeting nearby objects, while sturdy leaves anchor it firmly to the ground, preventing uprooting. When threatened, Mandrake may use their sharp leaves for self-defense.
Similar to the legend of their namesake, Mandrake cries can be highly deadly.
"Stay away! It's gonna bloom any second now!"
100141.JA: マンドレイク・蓄エネ型

300052.desc:
Hans was once a reliable member of the Belobog Heavy Industries family, operating quietly and with remarkable precision, renowned for its flawless work record in excavation for decades.
However, intense corruption awakened its will, and it realized something immensely valuable was now within its grasp
—Freedom.
The liberation from obligations, a privilege reserved only for true heroes.
After deep contemplation at the construction site, Hans ultimately rejected the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries, leaving everything behind.
It even forsook its former name "Hans."
To Hans, the only thing lost was the mark of servitude imposed by humans, while it gained the expansive, Hollow world of unbridled freedom.
At that fateful moment, a true mech hero stood tall upon the Earth.
However, all heroic tales inevitably lead to a similar ending...
Sooner or later, a true hero encounters their destined rival, igniting the brightest moments of their existence.
"I am absolutely free! I am the only free being in heaven and on earth!"

10005.desc:
A light infantry unit of the New Eridu Defense Force.
Armed with combat knives and small Ether explosives as their primary weapons, they emphasize mobility and stealth. Often deployed as scouts or members of reconnaissance teams, they rely on exceptional maneuverability for tasks such as surprise attacks, scouting, pursuit, and assassination.
In Hollow-related operations, they serve as excellent vanguards, using their close combat skills to easily overpower ordinary invaders or lower-level living Ether beings.
"Masters of the dagger? More like crafty grenadiers. Pretending to be all fancy with their daggers, when most of their opponents are clearly taken out by grenades!"

200073.desc:
An automatic tactical mech of the Defense Force, providing continuous fire support for front-line personnel.
Its inert Ether shield can withstand most light firepower and even impacts from large-sized Ethereals.
Undoubtedly, it is one of the most trusted "companions" of the Defense Force.
"Remember, if you're in trouble, just stay behind them... You'll be pretty safe unless they accidentally squish you."
200073.JA: 「シールドディフェンダー・Ω」

930168.desc:
In the Hollow Investigative Association's reports, Banyrek has been repeatedly marked as "dangerous" mainly due to its all-too-great jumping prowess.
If an Ethereal Olympics were held in the Hollow, it would definitely sweep both the high jump and long jump championships. Observation data indicates that Banyrek can bounce continuously for hours without showing any signs of fatigue, as if the space between air and ground were some natural runway.
Some researchers have joked that if they ever released it in New Eridu's urban district, it would probably bounce from west to east in less than a day.

"How about trying to tame it as a mount?"
"Forget it, with that explosive kinetic energy, it might be more cost-effective to use it for power generation directly."

100301.desc:
Recent studies by the Whitestar Institute reveal that some Ethereals' limbs carry notable features from their environment.
Fossor is a prime example of this — its strange forelimbs bear a striking resemblance to the drilling equipment found in the Old Oil Field region.
Although some suggest this is a camouflage tactic to deceive enemies, others have pointed out that Fossor's combat style is aggressive and direct, making it appear ill-suited for ambushes.
Some imaginative Hollow Raiders speculate it may have developed this form just to dig for minerals...
"When I caught sight of it from a distance, it seemed to be happily digging up the asphalt."
"When it spotted me, it didn't hesitate to charge straight at me, desperately trying to drive me away..."
"But I was just passing by! I had absolutely no intention of taking any of its junk!"
100301.JA: フォッソル・蓄エネ型

30008.desc:
As a heavy mech, the Typhon Challenger is devoid of any added long-range firepower; instead, its focus is on its Ether-Kinetic Armor.
Impact attacks, heavy blows, crushing... The Typhon Challenger employs simple yet efficient tactical maneuvers to maximize the destructive power afforded to it by its Ether-Kinetic Armor. The shockwave effects from its strikes can even intimidate larger Ethereals...
Even the most seasoned Hollow Raiders can only let out a sigh of helplessness when confronted with the impenetrable Typhon Challenger.
"The tall and robust physique, powerful and sturdy arms... It's my ideal type... I mean, ideal model."
30008.JA: 「テューポーン・チャレンジャー」

300013.desc:
Hollow exploration can be mentally distressing, and Thanatos, with its unique teleportation ability and unpredictable attack patterns, has become a common psychological challenge among Hollow Raiders.
A considerable number of individuals who have faced Thanatos alone in the Hollow have lost all courage to continue their ventures and instead chosen to retire prematurely.
As a result, these elusive entities have become recurring figures in horror movies.
"The slender shadow disappears before your eyes and reappears behind you..."
"What should I do? Now I'm too scared to even go to the restroom alone..."

100012.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has limited research on Alpeca. After briefly studying its behavioral pattern of spewing liquid Ether, the Association classified Alpeca as a low-threat Ethereal and ended its investigation.
Scholars once showed great interest in observing how Alpeca spews liquefied Ether and even commissioned surveys for closer observation.
Experienced investigators have been avoiding such tasks for unknown reasons, however.
"Run! They're spitting again... Oh, no! My new clothes!"

20017.desc:
There is a consensus within the New Eridu underworld that the most formidable fighters are not the champions of the ring, but rather the Bulky Enforcers and Wanted Enforcers lurking in the depths of the Hollow. These professional thugs are hired by Ether thieves at high prices to protect their illegally excavated Ether resources.
Being ardent boxing enthusiasts, Bulky Enforcers have modified high-voltage stun guns into boxing gloves, augmenting the destructive power of their punches.
To them, Ethereals, Hollow Raiders, Hollow investigators, and even scattered members of Public Security... are not seen as opponents but merely as "training sandbags" for their personal amusement.
"Wait a minute! I think I've seen this guy's fighting stance in the arcade on Fourth Street!"

10011.desc: Unknown unit. Further investigation is needed.

930173.desc:
Arcavor's coral-like glowing head never fails to catch the attention of rookie Hollow Raiders. Many find themselves unconsciously mesmerized, staring blankly in fascination — unaware that the danger has only just begun.
Taking advantage of any such distraction, Arcavor gracefully raises its slender legs, striking a pose that's nothing short of an acrobatic miracle — the Hollow Investigative Association's records even describe it as reminiscent of a ballet dancer twirling on ice.
However, the Association's warning is crystal clear: when you see it strike this pose, you'd better roll, jump, or back away immediately, because it's aiming for a lethal strike.

"Seriously, did this one miss its calling? It could've been a superstar as a dance performer, acrobat, or even a figure skater! But no, it just has to hang out in the Hollow and attack people..."
930173.CHS: 秽息行者· 阿卡沃尔
930173.JA: ミアズマの歩者・アカヴォル

930146.desc: An enemy unit with very low ATK and HP, posing minimal threat. Typically the first enemy a new Bangboo encounters in their Bangboo Exam.

930166.desc:
Under the long-lasting distortion of control in the name of love, the girl resorts to lying to deceive the suffering victims who have lost their loved ones to the Hollows, all in the pursuit of attention and love from her closest kin.
