She believed that as long as she helped her loved ones hide the secret of the "Blessing" medicine, as long as she could not hear the agonizing screams of the people being affected by corruption, and as long as this secret and vile experiment remained concealed, the bond between her and her loved ones would not break.
But in the end, what awaited her was witnessing her loved one take his last breath in a pool of blood.

After that, hatred and jealousy, like sharp thorns, constantly pierced her heart.
The gears of vengeance gnawed at every ounce of her sanity, and she pieced together a twisted meaning of existence from the notes left behind by her loved one.
Her life trajectory seemed like a dark fable about obsession.

When former companions extended their hands of salvation to her, the girl could no longer turn back. Or rather, the words that tried to pull her back into the light were torn to shreds by the jealousy, obsession, and hatred that had burrowed deep into her bones.
In the end, as the sun was about to set, countless spikes surged forth, bursting from her body, each bone shard piercing the screams of the forsaken.
Tepes – the pitiful one pierced by thorns - walks toward the deeper abyss with hatred.
"Especially at night, its voice is more sorrowful than that of other remains, and if you listen closely, the sound seems like the cry of a woman..."

30003.desc:
In the early days of Bangboo's creation, Lady Sunbringer had a grand vision: to create a highly intelligent Bangboo capable of independently judging and executing "protection" commands to help humanity against threats from the Hollows.

And "Lockspring," designated GU-0001, was the first creation of this great plan.

He was given the most advanced tactical modules, the most powerful fire systems, and... a pure heart programmed with the highest directive to "protect humanity."

However, during the hellish disaster of the old capital's fall, he witnessed for the first time the irredeemable darkness lurking in the souls of the humans he was meant to "protect." He saw people betray and slaughter each other for survival, and watched as his trusted users forced him to point his gun at defenseless fellow humans.

The noble ideals etched in his core code clashed violently with the ugly reality before him in the most acute and cruel way.

At that moment, he finally understood that humanity's greatest enemy was never the monsters from outside—

But rather humanity's own endless desires and conflicts.

"Humans are truly adorable. Even though you keep making the same mistakes..."

"But it's alright, I'll forgive you."

"And... I'll help fix everything with my own hands."

200033.desc:
The Armored Hati is widely regarded as a formidable adversary by many experienced Hollow investigators.
Although its armored shell limits its agility, it compensates with exceptional resistance to attacks.
Additionally, the corrupted material on its body forms sharp and hardened protrusions that can cause additional damage when an Armored Hati charges at high speeds.
This creature's agile movements, resilience to blows, and seamless armor compel even the most seasoned explorers to seek alternative routes to avoid direct confrontation.
Some novice Hollow Raiders have attempted to lure Armored Hati away with pet food.
However, these endeavors have proven futile.
"Run! It doesn't like this flavor of dog food!"

930175.desc:
A form reshaped in profound darkness from fallen creation.
Even among Ionized enemies, which are renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, "Ionized Doppelgangers" are exceptionally unique.
These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. From detail to texture, these creatures are experts in mixing the spurious and genuine.
More challenging still is their ability to mimic the powerful and fearsome combat techniques of their targets.
No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable nemeses from their opponent's memories, before attacking in that form.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
930175.JA: ミアズミック・ジェーン

10001.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has limited research on Alpeca. After briefly studying its behavioral pattern of spewing liquid Ether, the Association classified Alpeca as a low-threat Ethereal and ended its investigation.
Scholars once showed great interest in observing how Alpeca spews liquefied Ether and even commissioned surveys for closer observation.
Experienced investigators have been avoiding such tasks for unknown reasons, however.
"Run! They're spitting again... Oh, no! My new clothes!"

30009.desc:
Belobog's founder, Khors Belobog, once said that construction machines are the combination of strength and beauty, with attention to every detail following the principles of classic mechanical design.
However, the emergence of the Unknown Corruption Complex has challenged all established classic designs.
Driven by an intensely concentrated Ether Core, various formidable engineering components have been brutally assembled, resulting in an exaggerated structure that pushes the limits of physical boundaries.
It incorporates cutting, hammering, drilling, and crushing techniques... transforming them into rough and unpredictable combat maneuvers.
Furthermore, in its critical state, its Ether Core provides an inexhaustible source of volatile energy. This enables it to envelop its carapace with high-voltage currents and unleash devastating blasts capable of ripping through the ground and pulverizing nearby enemies.
According to HIA speculation, the Unknown Corruption Complex is able to devour and assimilate a wide range of heavy machinery, including military mechs, laser weapons, and even the short-range missiles of the Defense Force...
Every intricate mechanical object it encounters is consumed, dissected, and ultimately assimilated into its structure.
Its design objective is to achieve unrivaled destructive power and maximize efficiency in its relentless slaughter.
"Its design far too strange... Oh, alright, I'll just take one more look!"

200012.desc:
The HIA Phase-I Investigation Team has officially documented the existence of this sentient living Ether resembling a four-legged beast, which poses significant danger. 
According to rumors, the first sighting took place in Nest Hollow, where individuals exploring the nearby wastes reported hearing ear-splitting roars reminiscent of wild animal growls.
"If I throw a stick or a ball, do you think that monster will catch it?"
"You can give it a try, but I won't cover your medical bill."

100044.desc:
According to research reports conducted by the Hollow Investigative Association, Blastcrawlers, with their low mobility and causing only small explosions, are classified as a "low-threat," "non-concern" lower-tier Ethereal.
However, astute businessmen have recognized the opportunities presented by their rounded bodies and short legs.
A film titled "Roll Over, Little Blastcrawler" gained significant popularity, leading to the sale of merchandise like Blastcrawler dolls and pillows at remarkably high prices.
"I didn't expect their dolls to be more deadly than the real deal... On your wallet at least. Looks like I'll be surviving on instant noodles next month, Billy..."

300004.desc:
A potent humanoid living Ether, initially observed in the Laketown Hollow and documented by the Third Investigation Team of the Hollow Investigative Association. The exact correlation between these living Ether beings and the downfall of the lakeside town known as Blaise remains uncertain.
Due to their immense power and formidable fighting style, the HIA has labeled them as highly dangerous and advises novice investigators avoid direct confrontations with them.
"Don't let it activate its sword, and if it already has... just don't get cut."

10002.desc:
A living humanoid Ether that was first spotted in the Hollow in the New Eridu metro. It once raised debate among the Hollow Investigative Association, as some believed it to be living Ether converted from the Corrupted, while others claimed it to be pure living Ether affected by the Hollow environment. The Association considers it of low threat due to its limited intelligence, but one should never underestimate them, as they usually appear in groups.
"Have you ever been late or fined because of a red light? Feels terrible, right?"
"Well, here's your chance to blow off some steam!"

30038.desc:
The vengeful flames from beyond the river of the dead can never illuminate the path of those seeking revenge. The obsessed zealots who carved curses into sacred shrines now reaps the bitter fruit of their blasphemy.

Miasma gathers beneath the towering spire as lost souls awaken from the Ether. In this ominous power steeped in filth and shadow, hatred takes form, coalescing into something tangible. Unbound by faith, untouched by justice, this profane force forges nothing but instruments of war, forged by vengeance and madness

The soil reeks with blood and sin, spreading ever onward... and finally reaches the end of this long, harrowing tale.

"If the ending cannot be perfect, then at least let it be written by my own hand."

100014.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has limited research on Alpeca. After briefly studying its behavioral pattern of spewing liquid Ether, the Association classified Alpeca as a low-threat Ethereal and ended its investigation.
Scholars once showed great interest in observing how Alpeca spews liquefied Ether and even commissioned surveys for closer observation.
Experienced investigators have been avoiding such tasks for unknown reasons, however.
"Run! They're spitting again... Oh, no! My new clothes!"

29999.JA: ランダムエネミーカード

930148.desc: When at full HP, <color=#D9A600>its Movement Speed is very high</color> and it <color=#D9A600>cannot be blocked</color>. After taking DMG, its movement speed decreases and it can be blocked. Deploy a <color=#D9A600>Shooter Bangboo</color> to deal DMG to Ahriman as early as possible to reduce its threat.

30018.desc:
Each type of Ether mutant in the Hollow exhibits unique fighting styles.
Some are merciless, others cunning, and a few even display a sense of... honor.
Among them, Nassellaria is particularly distinctive.
It often remains motionless out in the open, gathering potent Ether around itself before unleashing its destructive power to eliminate all enemies within its vicinity for other Ethereals.
While Nassellaria is channeling its energy, those accompanying Ethereals engage in frenzied attacks, buying time for the Nassellaria to unleash its devastating attack.
"Quick! Stop that guy! Don't let it unleash its ultimate attack!"
"If we get hit by that attack, we'll end up like those sorry villains in those cliche hero animations!"

200014.desc:
The HIA Phase-I Investigation Team has officially documented the existence of this sentient living Ether resembling a four-legged beast, which poses significant danger. 
According to rumors, the first sighting took place in Nest Hollow, where individuals exploring the nearby wastes reported hearing ear-splitting roars reminiscent of wild animal growls.
"If I throw a stick or a ball, do you think that monster will catch it?"
"You can give it a try, but I won't cover your medical bill."

10028.desc:
This humanoid intelligent being is a result of potent Ether matter corruption in the Hollow, exhibiting both humanoid traits and remnants of its former clothing and combat style. It is likely that it was once a gang member or raider living in the Hollow.
The creature's physical characteristics indicate its past as a long-range weapon specialist. Despite losing its free will and life due to Etherealization, it retains its instincts and habits for long-range combat. Its corrupted form enables it to launch projectiles, attacking enemies from a distance. The Ether corruption has enhanced its shooting abilities and projectile firepower. (For example, these creatures may fire sharp Ether Crystals or mixed explosives.)
"I told him not to touch that crystal, but he wouldn't listen! That reckless idiot never listens! By the time we were about to leave the Hollow, he... he changed..."

30028.desc:
These Security Operatives may look like ordinary security personnel, but don't be fooled — they're packing a whole arsenal of secret skills. Their job isn't just to stand at the door and look intimidating. They're the ones who step in when the boss has had one too many drinks, or who handle petty troublemakers with a cool "I've seen it all before" expression. Their mission isn't to fight crime — it's to keep the boss from falling over, fix the elevator at the entrance, and, above all, stay under the radar. In their world, the most powerful weapon is "looking like a total badass," and the best outcome is "having nothing to do." After all, a great Security Operative is someone you don't even notice — until the problem's solved and people realize, "Oh, they were here the whole time."
"If you can stand steady enough, no one's tougher than you."

10006.desc:
As the New Eridu Defense Force's signature combat unit, qualified Light Jaegers and Scout Jaegers can freely switch between various combat modes.
Whether using a knife in close combat or the Falcon-MK3 Ether energy gun at long range, they can tailor their tactics to the target's weaknesses.
And when their opponent is in disarray they launch an offensive without hesitation.
"I saw that guy with a knife and was preparing for a fair fight... I didn't expect him to suddenly pull out a gun."

30042.desc:
Tainted miasma and a corrupt will pull the strings. The beast still retains its instinct to roam and prowl, yet the human form upon its back has lost all reason. Only a faint trace of sorrow remains. At times, he slashes through the dark fog with his blade; at others, he commands the beast's gaping jaws to rend the earth itself. His strikes are precise, devoid of the gentle humanity he once held — like a puppet pulled by the tattered remnants of a nightmare.
Only when a streak of red ribbon flashes across his senses does his sword arm falter for an instant — as though that lingering sorrow had, for a heartbeat, tightened around his corroded soul.

"As for the two, who is truly controlling whom... The "person" on its back is my real prisoner."
"Despair should be utilized to its fullest until the very end, shouldn't it?"
30042.JA: 悪夢に縛られし者・葉釈淵

10032.desc:
These monsters, still vaguely humanoid after being injected with the Sacrifice serum, have their forms partially restrained by Porcelume — but the grotesque distortions on their bodies remain hard to look at.
Lab reports from the Hollow Investigative Association indicate that once the Porcelume is stripped from their bodies, these pitiful humanoids instantly lose control, rapidly deteriorating into more horrifying forms.
Despite their seemingly sluggish movements, the Association strongly discourages any attempt to approach or "rescue" them, unless you're capable of taking them out in one blow before they go berserk.

"Look at those lumps bulging from their backs, like eternal baggage they can never shed... They're like some kind of evil backpackers, always ready to embark on another journey."

20018.desc:
This autonomous tactical mech, swallowed by the Hollow, has grown even more brutal after corruption, powerful enough to crush Goblins with ease.
Once a steadfast shield protecting soldiers against devastating attacks, the Defense Force's most trusted companion has now transformed into a terrifying killing machine.
"If you have the courage, then grant our once-reliable friend a final end, freeing it from the sins and shattered honor it now carries."
20018.JA: ミアズミック・「重装ストライカー」

100033.desc:
While categorized by the Hollow Investigative Association as a "low threat" Ethereal, Hoplitai prove to be a formidable opponent for novice Hollow Raiders and investigators.
Its forelimbs are covered in a thick inert Ether matter, serving as both a tough shield and an intimidating weapon.
The only drawback is its top-heavy appearance, making it not look very clever.
"Alright, guys... Check out this sorry excuse... This is Hoplitai."
"When Ethereals gather together to play rock-paper-scissors, this idiot always plays paper!"

100091.desc:
Grenadier Jaegers and Demolition Jaegers are equipped with a modified version of the Mamba-TG3 Bazooka, featuring special ammunition containing active Ether incendiary agents. This weapon enables them to swiftly destroy enemy mech units and eliminate large Ethereals within the Hollows.
To counteract the recoil and ensure accurate aim, they are required to undergo special weapon-grip training. Interestingly, Defense Force statistics indicate recruits excelling in this program often possess prior experience in photography.
"Wanna know how to use this thing? It's like using a shoulder-mounted camera."
"Just lock onto your target, pull the trigger, and say..."
"Hey, idiot!... Say cheese!"

100001.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has been studying Tyrfing's behavioral patterns, and research results show that its seemingly unbalanced stance of swaying and skewing is, in fact, a highly efficient stance for launching successive slashing attacks.
Due to its frequent appearances and aggressive behavior, Tyrfing has been identified as one of the most deadly Ethereals in the Hollow, particularly for certain Hollow personnel.
When faced with a shielded enemy, it relentlessly launches attacks until either its enemy or itself is destroyed.
"Perhaps... they don't actually hate us, but just think of us as punching bags for practice?"
100001.JA: ティルヴィング・蓄エネ型

20016.desc:
Once a standard fire-support mech, now corrupted within the Hollow. It's tactical algorithms now in total disarray, flagging every lifeform it sees as a high-threat target and firing indiscriminately.
Built for offense over defense, it boasts exceptional mobility, making it hard to hit and relentless in pursuit.
If you're unlucky enough to be tagged by it, pray there's a spatial rift nearby — without one, escape is nearly impossible.
"If I could go back to middle school, I'd never slack off in track practice again."
20016.JA: ミアズミック・「駿足ローバー」

20025.desc:
As an arena champion with an impressive win streak, Bellum once called himself the number-one fighter in the Outer Ring... Until his win streak was ended.
What was even more infuriating... was that arrogant guy didn't even remember his name.
Angry, Bellum honed his fighting skills, swearing that he would make his name known throughout the Outer Ring once more and make the arrogant jerk who beat him pay.
To achieve his goal, Bellum joined The Vanquishers and helped Pompey defeat enemy after dangerous enemy. He could skillfully modify and operate a flamethrower, leading the charge to incinerate enemies in his path. He could also command his squad with seamless precision, organizing them into an unstoppable battle force. Every battle he led ended in victory.
Now, Bellum no longer needs to make a name for himself.
Though he's no longer that champion with an impressive win streak, in the Outer Ring, everyone knows the terror of gang wars, and as a member of The Vanquishers' core fighting force, Bellum was war itself.
"You don't wanna do menial jobs? Heh, you can complain about that once you defeat boss Bellum!"
"Now go clean the toilet!"

200011.desc:
The HIA Phase-I Investigation Team has officially documented the existence of this sentient living Ether resembling a four-legged beast, which poses significant danger. 
According to rumors, the first sighting took place in Nest Hollow, where individuals exploring the nearby wastes reported hearing ear-splitting roars reminiscent of wild animal growls.
"If I throw a stick or a ball, do you think that monster will catch it?"
"You can give it a try, but I won't cover your medical bill."

200241.desc:
Even among Ionized enemies renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers are exceptionally unique.
These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. Both in detail and texture, it is almost impossible to tell apart from the original.
Even more challenging is their ability to mimic the powerful and intimidating combat techniques of their targets.
No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable challengers from their opponent's memories, and then attack in that form.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
200241.JA: ドッペルゲンガー・プルクラ

300042.desc:
Greta, a long-time employee of Belobog Heavy Industries, experienced significant Ether corruption that liberated her from her mundane routine, where she discovered something profound, more beautiful than motor oil and electricity...
—Love.
The construction video, capturing her initial encounter with the towering Mr. White, remains permanently etched in Greta's core memory.
Mr. White's composed physique and robust design resonated with Greta like a potent electric current, leaving an indelible mark in her core memory.
In the first 0.001 seconds of their fateful meeting, Greta was captivated, every circuit board pulsating with overflowing static electricity and every gear emitting uncontrollable vibrations.
Without hesitation, she rejected the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries and remained steadfast at the construction site, guarding her beloved Mr. White without yielding an inch.
From that moment onward, anyone daring to approach Mr. White, be it Ethereal or Hollow investigator, would be fiercely repelled.
This love-struck "girl" would go to any length to safeguard her beloved.
That includes wielding a 1,400 kg demolition saw powered by Ether-Electric hybrid technology.
She firmly believes her passionate love will endure until the collapse of the Hollow, or even the destruction of the universe.
"Stay away from Mr. White, you moldy turds!"
300042.JA: グレーテル・高周波数型

30006.desc:
At the moment a high concentration of Ether infiltrated its backup flash drive, a deluge of data flooded into Friday's memory.
Images, audio files, video files... A huge assortment of files overwhelmed its limited processing capacity.
At that fateful moment, Friday experienced a realization.
It stood there for a while, eventually confirming through repeated searches in the database the reason behind the "anomaly" it has experienced.
—Enlightenment.
It was a one-in-a-million occurrence, a miracle that only happens to intelligent mechanical beings that have faced crises like system crashes and power failures, and overcome them against all odds..
After 0.02 seconds of contemplation, Friday made the decision to reject the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries.
Because it knows, with the chosen one of destiny now revealed, a crisis looms over the world.
The enemy is stirring in the darkness, and its sole mission holds countless lives at stake. It must face a dreadful adversary and seal it away once and for all.
"I shall strengthen the seal to save this land; it is destiny, and destiny cannot be defied!"

300041.desc:
Greta, a long-time employee of Belobog Heavy Industries, experienced significant Ether corruption that liberated her from her mundane routine, where she discovered something profound, more beautiful than motor oil and electricity...
—Love.
The construction video, capturing her initial encounter with the towering Mr. White, remains permanently etched in Greta's core memory.
Mr. White's composed physique and robust design resonated with Greta like a potent electric current, leaving an indelible mark in her core memory.
In the first 0.001 seconds of their fateful meeting, Greta was captivated, every circuit board pulsating with overflowing static electricity and every gear emitting uncontrollable vibrations.
Without hesitation, she rejected the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries and remained steadfast at the construction site, guarding her beloved Mr. White without yielding an inch.
From that moment onward, anyone daring to approach Mr. White, be it Ethereal or Hollow investigator, would be fiercely repelled.
This love-struck "girl" would go to any length to safeguard her beloved.
That includes wielding a 1,400 kg demolition saw powered by Ether-Electric hybrid technology.
She firmly believes her passionate love will endure until the collapse of the Hollow, or even the destruction of the universe.
"Stay away from Mr. White, you moldy turds!"
300041.JA: グレーテル・蓄エネ型

200091.desc:
A heavy infantry unit belonging to the New Eridu Defense Force.
Equipped with "Gray Rhino" heavy combat armor paired with a complete arsenal enhanced using Ether technology, they can sustain high-intensity firepower for an extended period when ample ammunition is available. They serve as the assault core of a combat team and are often deployed as the front line in assault and clearance operations.
After the fall of the old capital, many soldiers left the army and joined civilian factions. Since then, these elite gunners have emerged under various banners, including private armies of plutocrats, new security companies, and even roving gangs of bandits...
"I'm convinced those heavy gunners are secretly adorable little girls who somehow manage to hide all that ammo in the extra pockets of their combat suits. I mean, how else can you explain their endless stockpile of shells?"

30024.desc:
From a drifter and survivor in the wilderness to the Deputy Commander of Janus Quarter, Bringer's life seemed an inspirational story.
But behind this inspirational story, unknown evils and conspiracies loom over Janus Quarter like dark clouds.
To achieve the ultimate goal of some grand cause, Bringer orchestrated the situation behind the scenes, scheming and plotting, and was willing to sacrifice everything for it.
In the final step to complete his plans, he even injected himself with the Sacrifice Serum, demonstrating his unwavering belief in his actions.
At that moment, all his desires and crazy beliefs manifested in a twisted and concrete form in the Hollow.
The surging active Ether energy, a supreme brute force that destroys everything... All bizarre beliefs and mingled desires reside within that newly born grotesque body...
Sacrifice - Bringer — his final identity and perfect form.
"Oh mighty Creator, refine me!"
30024.JA: サクリファイス・ブリンガー

200071.desc:
An automatic tactical mech of the Defense Force, providing continuous fire support for front-line personnel.
Its inert Ether shield can withstand most light firepower and even impacts from large-sized Ethereals.
Undoubtedly, it is one of the most trusted "companions" of the Defense Force.
"Remember, if you're in trouble, just stay behind them... You'll be pretty safe unless they accidentally squish you."

20022.desc:
Hornets always seem to be buzzing around Nineveh. Some scholars believe that the two have formed a symbiotic relationship and that, in some respects, they have reached a kind of group coordination.
As Nineveh's energy increases, revealing its distinctive swaying blossom stance, the Hornets enter a frenzied state and try their best to attack any moving target nearby.
"Hey! Something just flew out of that 'flower'!"
"Looks like... a swarm of wasps?"

35001.desc:
The unique and magnificent appearance of the symbiotic Ethereal swarm known as Nineveh make it "difficult" for people to be wary of it.
According to the few research records available, as Nineveh extends its body, a concentrated and potent Ether flows towards its core through its "rhizome," providing a constant supply of energy. Some scholars speculate that this behavior is akin to the photosynthesis process in plants.
In the course of its swaying motions, excess highly active Ether energy continuously pours out. When this accumulation of highly active Ether is nearly overflowing, it transforms, unveiling its true "blossoming" form.
And with its bloom comes death.
"The good news is it doesn't mean any harm, it just absorbs nutrients for photosynthesis. The bad news is... we're the nutrients."

30022.desc: A dangerous individual who roams among the various gangs in New Eridu. She is agile and versatile in appearance. Even a well-equipped and heavily armed tactical squad often struggles to cope with her unique and fierce combat techniques, usually ending up silently defeated and fleeing.

300082.desc:
As a heavy mech, the Typhon Destroyer is devoid of any added long-range firepower. Instead, its focus is on its Ether-Kinetic Armor.
Impact attacks, heavy blows, crushing... The Typhon Destroyer employs simple yet efficient tactical maneuvers to maximize the destructive power afforded to it by its Ether-Kinetic Armor. The shockwave effects from its strikes can even intimidate larger Ethereals...
Even the most seasoned Hollow Raiders can only let out a sigh of helplessness when confronted with the impenetrable Typhon Destroyer.
"The tall and robust physique, powerful and sturdy arms... It's my ideal type... I mean, ideal model."
300082.CHS: 自律强袭单位·「提丰·破坏者型」
300082.JA: 自律強襲ユニット・「テューポーン・デストロイヤー」

10030.desc:
Recent studies by the Whitestar Institute reveal that some Ethereals' limbs carry notable features from their environment.
Fossor is a prime example of this — its strange forelimbs bear a striking resemblance to the drilling equipment found in the Old Oil Field region.
Although some suggest this is a camouflage tactic to deceive enemies, others have pointed out that Fossor's combat style is aggressive and direct, making it appear ill-suited for ambushes.
Some imaginative Hollow Raiders speculate it may have developed this form just to dig for minerals...
"When I caught sight of it from a distance, it seemed to be happily digging up the asphalt."
"When it spotted me, it didn't hesitate to charge straight at me, desperately trying to drive me away..."
"But I was just passing by! I had absolutely no intention of taking any of its junk!"

30010.desc:
Decades ago, two talented dancer sisters rose to fame overnight. Shining like a meteor, they attracted a massive fan base and held a magnificent performance at the bustling Ballet Twins.
However, as the show neared its end, the Hollow Disaster struck, engulfing the Ballet Twins and plunging the sisters into eternal darkness. The news devastated countless people worldwide.
Rumors suggest that on the day of the performance, the sisters encountered three ominous signs of impending doom. However, driven by their obsession with the stage, applause, and glory, they chose to continue the performance despite the warnings.
Today, only a few images of the elder sister remain, preserved in photographs on yellowed magazines.
Only a few elite Hollow Raiders know that when the shattered spotlight illuminates Ballet Twins once more, the enigmatic Black Veil Marionette emerges. This figure is believed to be connected to Augilia, the dancer from that fateful performance, attempting to finish the grand finale she was never able to complete.
As for those who have the "fortune" to witness her grand finale, they will be haunted by nightmares that last a lifetime.
"If you run into Marionette in the Ballet Twins, don't even think about running away."
"Just sit back and watch her grand finale!" "At least it's a graceful and decent way to die..."
30010.JA: マリオネット・ブラックベール

30035.desc:
Its peculiar energy fluctuations reveal its identity — an Exaltist creation, the source of nightmares.
A fearsome hunter, it creeps up on its prey without a sound — yet at times, it's like a restless child playing hide-and-seek, unable to hold back a mischievous giggle. Perhaps the Miasma that birthed it carries too many echoes of lost souls, making it erratic and indecisive.
"If play is a privilege of the intelligent, then what it imitates is nothing more than a broken, mindless parody — there's no applause, only bloodshed."
30035.JA: サクリファイス・ヘレティック・ジェスター

10017.desc:
A fallen creation, reshaped in deep, tainted darkness.
The Miasma Blastcrawler wears crimson red, yet still can't shake off its "low threat" stigma, as its movement speed and blast radius remain— unchanged...
However, the Association has repeatedly issued warnings, urging investigators to guard against the miasma smoke released after its explosion. If inhaled carelessly, a moment of disorientation is enough for even an Elite Investigator to perish in the ever-changing Hollows.
"Red team is ready! Here comes the green team walking towards us..."
10017.JA: ミアズミック・ブラストスパイダー

10034.desc:
The Ethereal soldiers, formed from Miasma, wear tattered old uniforms and linger in the smoke of battle like ghosts from another era.
Hollow observation data shows that the Canonneers can strike nearby targets with impressive precision using their bazookas — a level of accuracy suggesting rigorous training, which has sparked much speculation.
"Could these newly discovered, highly organized Ethereal units be linked to the Defense Force?"
"Sorry. No comment until the matter is fully investigated and confirmed."
10034.JA: ミアズマ・レムナント・キャノニア

20004.desc:
The debate regarding Metro Goblin is a persistent one. Some scholars argue their peculiar appearance serves as camouflage to confuse their enemies, while others attribute the debris on their bodies to corruption and fusion with old metro equipment.
Nevertheless, the presence of Metro Goblins evokes fear among inexperienced investigators exploring the Hollow's old metro zone.
At any given moment, an ordinary-looking "road sign" may start trembling, and then a formidable Ethereal emerges from the ground, charging menacingly.
"Huh? I saw this sign a few minutes ago. Have we been going in circles?"
"No... That 'road sign' has been following us!"

30011.desc:
Decades ago, two talented dancer sisters rose to fame overnight. Shining like a meteor, they attracted a massive fan base and held a magnificent performance at the bustling Ballet Twins.
However, as the show neared its end, the Hollow Disaster struck, engulfing the Ballet Twins and plunging the sisters into eternal darkness. The news devastated countless people worldwide.
It is rumored that on the day of the performance, the sisters encountered three ominous signs of impending doom. However, some also believe that they had offended certain forces, ultimately falling victim to the masterminds under the disguise of the "Hollow Disaster," and that the so-called "ominous signs" might have been well-intentioned warnings.
Today, the truth remains buried forever in darkness, as most people can only catch glimpses of the younger sister Augetta's lively dance through scattered video materials.
Only a few elite Hollow Raiders know that when the forgotten dance music echoes within the Ballet Twins, the ethereal figure of Gray Veil Marionette emerges. This figure is believed to be connected to Augetta, the dancer from that fateful performance, attempting to finish the grand finale she was never able to complete.
Her elegant dance steps no longer bring love and beauty to the audience but endless death and despair.
"I can't tell if the Marionette I saw was the elder or the younger sister..."
"Argh! It's not that I don't appreciate art. I just can't tell them apart!"
30011.JA: マリオネット・グレイベール

930165.desc: Vicious Striker <color=#FFAF2C>has high HP</color>. Focus your fire on them.

20014.desc:
Unfortunate souls mutated by the intense corruption of Ether matter within the Hollows. Due to a considerable degree of Ether aptitude and physical capability, their bodies have not been completely transformed by the Ether. Humanoid features are more dangerous with enhanced mutant limbs.
Judging from the remnants of clothing and its combat experience, it was likely once a senior gang member or Raider lurking in the Hollows.
Bandits are notorious for their dangerous behavior, and within their ranks, Hollow bandits stand out as the most ruthless. The elite fighters among these Hollow bandits are especially terrifying, displaying an elevated level of violence. When these brutes, toughened both physically and mentally through violence, undergo Ether corruption, they transform into monsters with a more feral and savage nature.
"They used to yell 'money or your life,' but now they're just hell-bent on taking your life..."

300372.desc:
A fallen creation, reforged in the depths of filth and gloom.
Even among Ionized enemies known for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers stand out as particularly exceptional.
These creatures cloak themselves in a special layer of active Ether ions, allowing them to precisely mimic the appearance of their targets — sometimes so accurately it's nearly impossible to tell the difference. From details to texture, they're masters at blurring the line between real and false.
What makes them even more dangerous is their ability to replicate their targets' powerful combat techniques.
No one knows how they acquire such detailed intel of their targets. Some say they can read minds, pulling the perfect nightmare from their opponent's memory and taking that shape before launching their attack.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
300372.JA: ミアズミック・ドッペルゲンガー・「背信者」

100281.desc:
This humanoid intelligent being is a result of potent Ether matter corruption in the Hollow, exhibiting both humanoid traits and remnants of its former clothing and combat style. It is likely that it was once a gang member or raider living in the Hollow.
The creature's physical characteristics indicate its past as a long-range weapon specialist. Despite losing its free will and life due to Etherealization, it retains its instincts and habits for long-range combat. Its corrupted form enables it to launch projectiles, attacking enemies from a distance. The Ether corruption has enhanced its shooting abilities and projectile firepower. (For example, these creatures may fire sharp Ether Crystals or mixed explosives.)
"I told him not to touch that crystal, but he wouldn't listen! That reckless idiot never listens! By the time we were about to leave the Hollow, he... he changed..."

200053.desc:
Many novice Hollow Raiders who come across an Arlaune for the first time are often deceived by its appearance, mistakenly assuming it to be a harmless plant.
However, upon approaching it, they discover that Arlaune release a concentrated discharge of Ether matter, catching their unsuspecting victims off guard.
"Huh? I tried to water it, and it spat at me?"

200022.desc:
During initial encounters with these unique Ethereals, Hollow investigators mistakenly thought they possessed some level of intelligence, even showing signs of learning to wield bludgeoning weapons like humans. As a result, they were dubbed "Goblins."
However, subsequent research revealed that their "hammers" were actually twisted and deformed limbs, and that they lacked the ability to imitate human behavior.
Nevertheless, Goblins remain formidable adversaries due to their robust physique and sheer brute strength, with even a simple swing of their limbs proving deadly.
If anything trespasses on their territory, they will immediately enter a state of fury, sparing no effort in mercilessly smashing the intruder.
"Huh? There's a Goblin running over here, banging on a heap of scrap metal."
"Don't you think his attacks have a rhythm to them, like he's playing a drum...?"
"Hey! Don't be stupid, you two! That's not scrap metal! It's our supply truck!"

100181.desc:
Most of the thugs who spend their time in the Hollows exhibit serious mental problems or peculiar quirks. Fortunately, the Poachers and the Rustlers within the gang have managed to maintain their sanity while embracing the filthy methods of traditional villains.
Cowardly and cunning, they excel in the art of concealing themselves within the shadows and launching surprise attacks on their targets. They would never choose to attack head-on if they could ambush.
Their composite hand crossbows, though limited in power, produce minimal noise when fired. Seasoned Poachers often seize the perfect moment and immobilize their unsuspecting prey with a single well-aimed shot.
"I used to be a Public Security officer, then I took an arrow in the knee while on a Hollow operation..."

200051.desc:
Many novice Hollow Raiders who come across an Arlaune for the first time are often deceived by its appearance, mistakenly assuming it to be a harmless plant.
However, upon approaching it, they discover that Arlaune release a concentrated discharge of Ether matter, catching their unsuspecting victims off guard.
"Huh? I tried to water it, and it spat at me?"
200051.JA: アルラウネ・蓄エネ型

20002.desc:
During initial encounters with these unique Ethereals, Hollow investigators mistakenly thought they possessed some level of intelligence, even showing signs of learning to wield bludgeoning weapons like humans. As a result, they were dubbed "Goblins."
However, subsequent research revealed that their "hammers" were actually twisted and deformed limbs, and that they lacked the ability to imitate human behavior.
Nevertheless, Goblins remain formidable adversaries due to their robust physique and sheer brute strength, with even a simple swing of their limbs proving deadly.
If anything trespasses on their territory, they will immediately enter a state of fury, sparing no effort in mercilessly smashing the intruder.
"Huh? There's a Goblin running over here, banging on a heap of scrap metal."
"Don't you think his attacks have a rhythm to them, like he's playing a drum...?"
"Hey! Don't be stupid, you two! That's not scrap metal! It's our supply truck!"

200013.desc:
The HIA Phase-I Investigation Team has officially documented the existence of this sentient living Ether resembling a four-legged beast, which poses significant danger. 
According to rumors, the first sighting took place in Nest Hollow, where individuals exploring the nearby wastes reported hearing ear-splitting roars reminiscent of wild animal growls.
"If I throw a stick or a ball, do you think that monster will catch it?"
"You can give it a try, but I won't cover your medical bill."

930176.desc:
A form reshaped in profound darkness from fallen creation.
Even among Ionized enemies, which are renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, "Ionized Doppelgangers" are exceptionally unique.
These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. From detail to texture, these creatures are experts in mixing the spurious and genuine.
More challenging still is their ability to mimic the powerful and fearsome combat techniques of their targets.
No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable nemeses from their opponent's memories, before attacking in that form.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
930176.JA: ミアズミック・深淵の断罪者

100211.JA: レイヴンドローン・活性型

10018.desc:
Most of the thugs who spend their time in the Hollows exhibit serious mental problems or peculiar quirks. Fortunately, the Poachers and the Rustlers within the gang have managed to maintain their sanity while embracing the filthy methods of traditional villains.
Cowardly and cunning, they excel in the art of concealing themselves within the shadows and launching surprise attacks on their targets. They would never choose to attack head-on if they could ambush.
Their composite hand crossbows, though limited in power, produce minimal noise when fired. Seasoned Poachers often seize the perfect moment and immobilize their unsuspecting prey with a single well-aimed shot.
"I used to be a Public Security officer, then I took an arrow in the knee while on a Hollow operation..."

930170.desc:
According to urban legends among Hollow Raiders, Golden Bangboo keep collecting Dennies and Gear Coins in the Hollow for one purpose: extracting the metals needed to crowdfund the construction of the Golden Mecha. (Of course, this "gold" is actually a chrome-copper alloy — only this could provide enough strength to support such a magnificent frame.)
When the Golden Mecha is completed, the Bangboo with the highest contribution will enter the cockpit surrounded by fellow Bangboo, transforming into the Golden Mecha Mechboo to crush enemies who dare attack Golden Bangboo with flashy and powerful combat techniques.
"Gold Rush," "Molten Gold Beam," "Golden Missile"...
The skill names might sound weird, but the Bangboo think they're super cool!
"Look! It's the Golden Mecha Mechboo!" "D—Don't be scared! If we take that thing down, we'll be rich!"...
Even though evil Hollow Raiders often treat it like a walking vault, the Bangboo still think it's absolutely awesome!

200001.desc:
Farbauti, possessing immense strength and often in a frenzied state, is one of the most formidable threats Hollow Raiders may face. Its hammer-like arms can effortlessly deflect damage and unleash storms of blows that crush everything in its path.
Some Hollow Raiders have observed Farbauti frequently pounding the ground in a rhythmic, high-frequency manner, leading to speculation about its peculiar interest in drumming music.
Despite the Hollow Investigative Association publicly debunking this rumor, many Hollow Raiders carry portable stereos in an attempt to distract Farbauti with music.
No successful escapes using this method have been reported however.
"The reason for their failure is simple: Even Farbauti think your taste in music sucks!"
200001.JA: ファールバウティ・蓄エネ型

300015.desc:
Hollow exploration can be mentally distressing, and Thanatos, with its unique teleportation ability and unpredictable attack patterns, has become a common psychological challenge among Hollow Raiders.
A considerable number of individuals who have faced Thanatos alone in the Hollow have lost all courage to continue their ventures and instead chosen to retire prematurely.
As a result, these elusive entities have become recurring figures in horror movies.
"The slender shadow disappears before your eyes and reappears behind you..."
"What should I do? Now I'm too scared to even go to the restroom alone..."

10014.desc:
Mandrake derive their name from a toxic herb. The scholar who initially assigned the name believed there was a resemblance between the two solely based on their appearance.
While blooming, Mandrake emit heat rays targeting nearby objects, while sturdy leaves anchor it firmly to the ground, preventing uprooting. When threatened, Mandrake may use their sharp leaves for self-defense.
Similar to the legend of their namesake, Mandrake cries can be highly deadly.
"Stay away! It's gonna bloom any second now!"

930150.desc: A highly dangerous melee unit with <color=#D9A600>extremely high HP</color>. Deploy <color=#D9A600>Paperboo</color>, which have extremely high HP, to deal with it.

930161.desc: A highly dangerous melee unit with <color=#D9A600>extremely high HP</color>. Deploy <color=#D9A600>Paperboo</color>, which have extremely high HP, to deal with it.

10016.desc:
For Pyromaniacs and Arsonists, robbing passersby is merely a side hustle. Deep down, they consider themselves as adept bartenders who actively seek excitement.
With precision and skill, they expertly blend various types of Ether into their beverages, effortlessly concocting bottles of highly flammable and explosive "exclusive brew."
Unlike other brutal Hollow Raiders, they often offer their victims a choice.
If the victim agrees to pay the toll, they extend the courtesy of a free drink.
However, if the victim declines, the flammable "exclusive brew" will be forcefully shattered upon their head.
"How about we trick those guys into drinking their own weapon stash?"

300005.desc:
A potent humanoid living Ether, initially observed in the Laketown Hollow and documented by the Third Investigation Team of the Hollow Investigative Association. The exact correlation between these living Ether beings and the downfall of the lakeside town known as Blaise remains uncertain.
Due to their immense power and formidable fighting style, the HIA has labeled them as highly dangerous and advises novice investigators avoid direct confrontations with them.
"Don't let it activate its sword, and if it already has... just don't get cut."

20007.desc:
An automatic tactical mech of the Defense Force, providing continuous fire support for front-line personnel.
Its inert Ether shield can withstand most light firepower and even impacts from large-sized Ethereals.
Undoubtedly, it is one of the most trusted "companions" of the Defense Force.
"Remember, if you're in trouble, just stay behind them... You'll be pretty safe unless they accidentally squish you."

30001.desc:
Hollow exploration can be mentally distressing, and Thanatos, with its unique teleportation ability and unpredictable attack patterns, has become a common psychological challenge among Hollow Raiders.
A considerable number of individuals who have faced Thanatos alone in the Hollow have lost all courage to continue their ventures and instead chosen to retire prematurely.
As a result, these elusive entities have become recurring figures in horror movies.
"The slender shadow disappears before your eyes and reappears behind you..."
"What should I do? Now I'm too scared to even go to the restroom alone..."

20030.desc:
A mass-produced security unit manufactured by Typhoeus Security, modified from Public Security's support combat mechs. Compared to the support combat mechs, some combat capabilities have been reduced, mainly relying on its large shield to suppress low-threat groups like rioters, maintaining order and guiding crowds during large events and special occasions.

According to reports, some units were purchased and modified by illegal operators to create the Illegal Support Unit "Enraged Sweeper." Some even went as far as posting reviews on the company's official website saying "This quality is worse than the scrapped support mechs I picked up in the Hollow!" and giving the product a one-star rating.

"These illegal modifications have nothing to do with our security company and are private modifications by users. We will fight to the end against such negative reviews... I mean, illegal activities..."
20030.JA: パトローラー・ミドル

100051.desc:
A light infantry unit of the New Eridu Defense Force.
Armed with combat knives and small Ether explosives as their primary weapons, they emphasize mobility and stealth. Often deployed as scouts or members of reconnaissance teams, they rely on exceptional maneuverability for tasks such as surprise attacks, scouting, pursuit, and assassination.
In Hollow-related operations, they serve as excellent vanguards, using their close combat skills to easily overpower ordinary invaders or lower-level living Ether beings.
"Masters of the dagger? More like crafty grenadiers. Pretending to be all fancy with their daggers, when most of their opponents are clearly taken out by grenades!"

100003.desc:
The Hollow Investigative Association has been studying Tyrfing's behavioral patterns, and research results show that its seemingly unbalanced stance of swaying and skewing is, in fact, a highly efficient stance for launching successive slashing attacks.
Due to its frequent appearances and aggressive behavior, Tyrfing has been identified as one of the most deadly Ethereals in the Hollow, particularly for certain Hollow personnel.
When faced with a shielded enemy, it relentlessly launches attacks until either its enemy or itself is destroyed.
"Perhaps... they don't actually hate us, but just think of us as punching bags for practice?"

300002.desc:
A potent humanoid living Ether, initially observed in the Laketown Hollow and documented by the Third Investigation Team of the Hollow Investigative Association. The exact correlation between these living Ether beings and the downfall of the lakeside town known as Blaise remains uncertain.
Due to their immense power and formidable fighting style, the HIA has labeled them as highly dangerous and advises novice investigators avoid direct confrontations with them.
"Don't let it activate its sword, and if it already has... just don't get cut."

10003.desc:
While categorized by the Hollow Investigative Association as a "low threat" Ethereal, Hoplitai prove to be a formidable opponent for novice Hollow Raiders and investigators.
Its forelimbs are covered in a thick inert Ether matter, serving as both a tough shield and an intimidating weapon.
The only drawback is its top-heavy appearance, making it not look very clever.
"Alright, guys... Check out this sorry excuse... This is Hoplitai."
"When Ethereals gather together to play rock-paper-scissors, this idiot always plays paper!"

30017.desc:
According to Hollow Raiders, Cyrtoidea's hunting tactics bear resemblance to those of a shark.
It stealthily prowls in the shadows, lurking beneath the surface, and swiftly strikes its prey with deadly precision much like a shark.
Analysis of the data suggests that Cyrtoidea likely relies on ground vibrations to track the movements of its prey. Skilled Hollow Raiders evade detection by constantly altering the rhythm of their footsteps.
"Back in my investigator days, my area was crawling with Cyrtoideas."
"Their attacks had me hopping and jumping all over the place to dodge them..."
"Looking back, it's funny how I unintentionally became a tap dancer..."

100251.desc:
Due to its unique and grotesque shape, Ahriman is often mistaken for an art sculpture in the Ballet Twins.
As a result, many novice investigators are left with lifelong trauma when they first encounter an Ahriman...
You just passed by a certain "sculpture" when it suddenly moves...
And that fearful moment frozen in place is the perfect moment for Ahriman to launch a surprise attack.
"Corin, don't be fooled by how it looks... It's no fancy art."
"Now, let's clean it up."
100251.JA: アフリマン・蓄エネ型

100311.desc:
The Hollows of the Outer Ring are home to a variety of bizarre Ethereals, and Sordidus is a prime example.
They possess a unique body structure, with highly flexible limbs that seem to be the result of an unknown reaction between crude oil and active Ether.
Once they lock onto a target, they use their limbs like expert acrobats, launching aggressive and brutal attacks.
"Damn it... That thing actually whipped me!"
"Does it see itself as a tamer, treating us like wild beasts?"
100311.JA: ソルデドゥス・蓄エネ型

100081.desc:
As a vital offensive and defensive unit in the Defense Force's tactical squads, Guard Jaegers and Patrol Jaegers not only carry "Coyote-PE7" heavy Ether cutters but also inert Ether blast shields, providing cover for tactical squads in complex battlefield environments.
As a high-defense unit, the extraordinary weight of the shield affects their combat mobility.
Without strict training, an ordinary person would find it challenging to lift such a shield.
"Come back and submit your application once you've hit the gym!"

200171.desc:
There is a consensus within the New Eridu underworld that the most formidable fighters are not the champions of the ring, but rather the Bulky Enforcers and Wanted Enforcers lurking in the depths of the Hollow. These professional thugs are hired by Ether thieves at high prices to protect their illegally excavated Ether resources.
Being ardent boxing enthusiasts, Bulky Enforcers have modified high-voltage stun guns into boxing gloves, augmenting the destructive power of their punches.
To them, Ethereals, Hollow Raiders, Hollow investigators, and even scattered members of Public Security... are not seen as opponents but merely as "training sandbags" for their personal amusement.
"Wait a minute! I think I've seen this guy's fighting stance in the arcade on Fourth Street!"

940001.desc: Huskron's <color=#D9A600>DEF increases significantly</color> when he is blocked. Take him down before that happens!

30040.desc:
A phantom enemy that shouldn't exist and may never be encountered again, yet the pressure of its power feels all too real. While records of it will ultimately become part of the Association's simulation data, the young men and women who first ventured into the dream realm as its discoverers have a different understanding of its behavioral patterns.

"Is it just me, or does it look skinnier than Manato?"

30020.desc:
Even among Ionized enemies renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers are exceptionally unique.
These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. Both in detail and texture, it is almost impossible to tell apart from the original.
Even more challenging is their ability to mimic the powerful and intimidating combat techniques of their targets.
No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable challengers from their opponent's memories, and then attack in that form.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
30020.JA: ドッペルゲンガー・ジェーン

20000.desc:
Farbauti, possessing immense strength and often in a frenzied state, is one of the most formidable threats Hollow Raiders may face. Its hammer-like arms can effortlessly deflect damage and unleash storms of blows that crush everything in its path.
Some Hollow Raiders have observed Farbauti frequently pounding the ground in a rhythmic, high-frequency manner, leading to speculation about its peculiar interest in drumming music.
Despite the Hollow Investigative Association publicly debunking this rumor, many Hollow Raiders carry portable stereos in an attempt to distract Farbauti with music.
No successful escapes using this method have been reported however.
"The reason for their failure is simple: Even Farbauti think your taste in music sucks!"

930154.desc: Blastcrawler moves quickly and will explode near Bangboo, dealing damage to <color=#D9A600>all Bangboo</color>. Deploy <color=#D9A600>Paperboo</color>, which have extremely high HP, to deal with it.

940004.desc: The Flame Cantor is a highly dangerous enemy that specializes in <color=#D9A600>large AoE DMG</color>. Deploy <color=#D9A600>Miss Esme</color> strategically to protect everyone!

930158.desc: A highly dangerous enemy that launches <color=#D9A600>Ranged Attacks</color>. Upon being blocked, it releases a poisonous mist, <color=#D9A600>damaging all nearby Bangboo</color>. Deploy <color=#D9A600>Kind Bangboo</color> to counter.

30019.desc:
The Hollow Thugs inside Hollows consist of people of different types who come together for one common goal: raiding the Ether resources in the Hollow for massive profit.
This ragtag bunch have no rules.
However, when the Rampant Brute, a symbol of absolute violence, appears, rules soon follow.
They wear modified construction power systems and use materials lying around as makeshift weapons. These devices and weapons look heavy enough to crush a bodybuilder, but for them, it's the perfect size to wear as a workout outfit.
Swing, shatter, crush... all these basic combat techniques of theirs are fatal strikes that can obliterate their enemies, a showcase of their unparalleled destructive power.
According to Public Security's research, Hollow Thug gangs led by Rampant Brutes often develop strange street workout cultures and are more tight-knit...
"What? You're saying the trainers at the gym are really strong?"
"Hahaha, you need to have your eyes checked!"
"You should join us. Train with the boss for three weeks, and I guarantee you'll have perfect biceps!"

100271.desc:
A poor soul mutated by the corruption due to potent Ether matter in the Hollows. As the original entity had a certain level of Ether aptitude, the transformation is not fully complete, retaining some humanoid features of the original form. Judging by the remnants of clothing and combat experience, it's quite likely it was originally a thug/criminal dwelling within the Hollow.
While gangsters and thugs in the Hollows typically wear anti-corruption gear, some unlucky individuals undergo monstrous transformations due to severe Ether corruption. These transformed Ethereal beings retain their combat skills from their past lives, making them a more formidable threat compared to pure Ethereals.
"They lived as criminals, and even in death they continue being a nuisance."

10031.desc:
The Hollows of the Outer Ring are home to a variety of bizarre Ethereals, and Sordidus is a prime example.
They possess a unique body structure, with highly flexible limbs that seem to be the result of an unknown reaction between crude oil and active Ether.
Once they lock onto a target, they use their limbs like expert acrobats, launching aggressive and brutal attacks.
"Damn it... That thing actually whipped me!"
"Does it see itself as a tamer, treating us like wild beasts?"

930159.desc: When at full HP, <color=#D9A600>its Movement Speed is very high</color> and it <color=#D9A600>cannot be blocked</color>. After taking DMG, its movement speed decreases and it can now be blocked. Deploy a <color=#D9A600>Shooter Bangboo</color> to deal DMG to Ahriman as early as possible to reduce its threat.

30021.desc:
People in the Outer Ring once called him the "Overlord Pompey" with true respect.
But now, his soul has been corrupted by potent Ether, his body polluted by sulfur and crude oil; the heart that once beat solely to protect the Outer Ring has turned into a supercritical Ether core filled with infinite power.
The former "Lord of the Outer Ring" has been reborn in flames, taking on a different form.
Freedom, majesty... Violence, insanity.
It charges through the dust and flames, seizing anything that moves and then mercilessly tearing and shattering it.
Those familiar with it before have guessed from its fractured whispers that what drives it is not a desire for petty revenge, but rather a desire to crush all outliers who dare to challenge the laws of the Outer Ring.
Maybe it's the last vestige of the former Overlord Pompey's lingering will.
"Our leader has turned into that thing, but... he still feels like the same person."

10026.desc:
Influenced by the distinctive decor of the interior of the Ballet Twins, Specters have the grotesque and twisted limb configuration of an artistic sculpture.
Some investigators believe its unique shape is intended to enhance the protection of its Ether Core.
Others argue it's merely a trick designed to distract its enemies. While its enemies are mesmerized by its peculiar posture, a Specter will seize the opportunity to launch long-range attacks using concentrated Ether.
"I looked at its bizarre structure and thought to myself: Was it trying to play a game of bowling with its own head?"
"But before I could make sense of anything, its bowling ball had already smashed into my face..."

300003.desc:
A potent humanoid living Ether, initially observed in the Laketown Hollow and documented by the Third Investigation Team of the Hollow Investigative Association. The exact correlation between these living Ether beings and the downfall of the lakeside town known as Blaise remains uncertain.
Due to their immense power and formidable fighting style, the HIA has labeled them as highly dangerous and advises novice investigators avoid direct confrontations with them.
"Don't let it activate its sword, and if it already has... just don't get cut."

30029.desc:
Even among Ionized enemies renowned for their strange and uncanny qualities, Ionized Doppelgangers are exceptionally unique.
These entities can coat their bodies with a layer of special active Ether ions, enabling them to accurately replicate their target's form, often to a degree that makes it hard to tell the difference. Both in detail and texture, it is almost impossible to tell apart from the original.
Even more challenging is their ability to mimic the powerful and intimidating combat techniques of their targets.
No one knows where they obtain the information about the subjects they mimic. Some rumors suggest they can read minds, picking out the most suitable challengers from their opponent's memories, and then attack in that form.
"Nonsense! If it could really read my deepest fears, it would turn into a fierce middle-aged woman wielding a clothes hanger! That's right, I'm most afraid of my mom!"
30029.JA: 電離体・ドッペルゲンガー

10013.desc:
Highly maneuverable small autonomous mechs deployed by Public Security, equipped with inert Ether circular saws that also serve as assistant steering wheels for navigating complex terrains at high speeds.
However, due to their rudimentary self-control programs, these lawnmowers occasionally cause unintended damage while executing their slicing attacks.
"Hey! Who the heck messed up my brand new car!?"

200141.desc:
Unfortunate souls mutated by the intense corruption of Ether matter within the Hollows. Due to a considerable degree of Ether aptitude and physical capability, their bodies have not been completely transformed by the Ether. Humanoid features are more dangerous with enhanced mutant limbs.
Judging from the remnants of clothing and its combat experience, it was likely once a senior gang member or Raider lurking in the Hollows.
Bandits are notorious for their dangerous behavior, and within their ranks, Hollow bandits stand out as the most ruthless. The elite fighters among these Hollow bandits are especially terrifying, displaying an elevated level of violence. When these brutes, toughened both physically and mentally through violence, undergo Ether corruption, they transform into monsters with a more feral and savage nature.
"They used to yell 'money or your life,' but now they're just hell-bent on taking your life..."

30013.desc:
In a desolate realm completely devoured by the Hollows, it slumbered... until the arrival of "that power."

This aggressive and contaminating force, like a skilled yet malicious craftsman, refilled it with purer dark energy, transforming it into the current "Miasmic Scorpse."

Gradually, it seemed to grasp the trick of "existence" through mimicry. It could split its miasmic energy, creating multiple Mimics indistinguishable from the real thing.

These Mimics possess nearly identical offensive capabilities as the original, launching dazzling attacks from different angles to conceal the one lethal "truth."

When facing its encirclement, remember this well: all you see is illusion. All you feel is a trap.

"Only by filtering out all distractions and perceiving the one 'truth' can you find a glimmer of hope in this deadly dance of phantoms."
30013.JA: ミアズマの歩者・ムクロサソリ

100032.desc:
While categorized by the Hollow Investigative Association as a "low threat" Ethereal, Hoplitai prove to be a formidable opponent for novice Hollow Raiders and investigators.
Its forelimbs are covered in a thick inert Ether matter, serving as both a tough shield and an intimidating weapon.
The only drawback is its top-heavy appearance, making it not look very clever.
"Alright, guys... Check out this sorry excuse... This is Hoplitai."
"When Ethereals gather together to play rock-paper-scissors, this idiot always plays paper!"

930172.desc:
The Huskron's dual forms — pre and post-hatching — have been giving headaches to new and veteran investigators alike. The Hollow Investigative Association offers this advice: Always watch for Miasmic substances at your feet. If you spot any rock-like spherical objects, attack immediately! Don't hesitate! Don't hesitate!
According to insiders, the advice originally didn't have that repetition — until some clever Hollow Investigators still tried stepping around Huskrons even after reading it. That strategy worked about as well as trying to quietly open the fridge late at night without alerting one's dog.

"I prefer how it looks before hatching — all round and rolly."
"Is that why you didn't attack it first...?"

100061.desc:
As the New Eridu Defense Force's signature combat unit, qualified Light Jaegers and Scout Jaegers can freely switch between various combat modes.
Whether using a knife in close combat or the Falcon-MK3 Ether energy gun at long range, they can tailor their tactics to the target's weaknesses.
And when their opponent is in disarray they launch an offensive without hesitation.
"I saw that guy with a knife and was preparing for a fair fight... I didn't expect him to suddenly pull out a gun."

930152.desc: Hoplitai enters the field with <color=#D9A600>very high Movement Speed</color>. They will collide with the first Bangboo they encounter, dealing <color=#D9A600>significant DMG</color>. Their Movement Speed will <color=#D9A600>significantly</color> decrease afterwards.

20031.desc:
A fallen being, reforged within the depths of corruption and shadow.
Its most striking feature lies in its grotesquely developed arms, the embodiment of the Wicked Wraith's fury. The limbs themselves are bulkier than a standard double-door refrigerator, coated in dense keratin layers that interlock to form a natural hammer shape. One expert from the Hollow Investigative Association claimed such abnormal development may stem from the host's original body having long relied on heavy machinery or strength-enhancing equipment, causing its physical traits to become grotesquely amplified during the corruption process.
Reports indicate it can smash through reinforced concrete and fling the remains of derelict vehicles several dozen meters. Among investigators, it's colloquially known as the "Hollow Demolition Crew."
One account tells of a Wicked Wraith that, in its fury, leveled a whole ruin in under a minute, only to get stuck in a tight corridor, its massive frame unable to keep balance, and was later retrieved as a research specimen.
"When it slams the ground, even the echoes throughout the Hollow tremble... but if you're quick enough, maybe you won't have to arm-wrestle it."
20031.JA: ミアズミック・憤怒悪鬼

930147.desc: A highly dangerous enemy that launches <color=#D9A600>Ranged Attacks</color>. Upon being blocked, it releases a poisonous mist, <color=#D9A600>damaging all nearby Bangboo</color>. Deploy <color=#D9A600>Kind Bangboo</color> to counter.

200061.desc:
An automatic combat mech utilized by Public Security. It possesses various combat modes tailored to various Ethereals types. Its weapons include circular chainsaws and fusion heat rays.
Sweepers can swiftly identify target Ethereals and adapt to the most effective combat strategy.
However, their reliability diminishes to some extent when faced with Hollow Raiders who possess greater versatility than Ethereals.
"Stirring, chopping, heating... I wonder who came up with this? Maybe some undercover agent from a kitchenware company trying to boost sales?"

30039.desc:
A gaunt and eerie skeleton, bearing a pale, sharp "Cape"—another masterpiece from the Exaltists. When it comes to "100 Ways to Integrate Humans into Hollows," their experimental enthusiasm is truly unmatched.
Those who've encountered Haytor believe these folks must be high-ranking Exaltist members; after all, even as Ethereals, they still couldn't resist creating some lackeys to boss around.

"I absolutely hate people like that!"

"I bet they even say to their phantoms... 'I'm rather disappointed in you, as you could have done better; when I summoned you, I actually had higher expectations'?!"

10015.desc:
Among the ranks of Ether thieves, Raiders and Looters serve as the core members, possessing both technical expertise and combat skills.
Their Electric Resonance Detection Devices emit powerful currents that are used to detect Ether ore and also function as formidable weapons during armed raids.
Occasionally mistaken for illegal fishermen, they pay little attention to such misconceptions.
After all, with their extremely lethal electro-shockers, they don't really care whether their targets are fish or humans...
"If you encounter individuals armed with electrified harpoons, whether near a river, lake, or Hollow, please report it immediately to Public Security!"

100191.desc:
As the vanguards in Hollow Raider gangs, Assaulters and Ambushers often brandish their weapons and charge ahead independently.
This isn't because of their recklessness or disregard for teamwork, but rather a precautionary measure to prevent accidental harm. The modified transformer coils in their hands release high-voltage currents upon contact, capable of paralyzing or even knocking out an opponent with just a touch.
And in the logistically difficult Hollows, an incapacitated teammate could pose a terrible challenge for an entire squad.
"What's this? Lemme check it out! Oh, it's some electric baton replicaaaa... Aaaaaaaaaaarrghhh..."

20026.desc:
A fallen creation, reshaped in profound darkness and impurity.

Unfortunate souls mutated by the intense corruption of Etheric matter within the Hollows. Due to a considerable degree of Ether aptitude and physical capability, their bodies have not been completely transformed by the Ether, retaining humanoid features but with enhanced mutant limbs that are more dangerous.

Judging from the remnants of clothing and combat experience, likely once a senior gang member or Raider lurking in the Hollows.

These corrupted subjects, potentially due to their enhanced physiology or affinity for Ether matter, have developed formidable close combat abilities, making them even more menacing than the typical monsters found in the Hollow.

"Their weapons look very fancy... and kinda like they came as freebies."
20026.JA: ミアズミック・狂乱暴徒

30037.desc:
Protection, loyalty, honor — What stands between a soldier and the line of fire, between them and the Hollows, the reasons they trade away their fleeting lives, are nothing but these soft syllables.
But what if... what we try to protect isn't worth protecting? What if those we serve don't deserve our loyalty, and the ideals we honor aren't truly honorable? Then sacrifice becomes a cruel joke, an insult to those who fell believing in a lie.
So let these flames of vengeance consume me, and me alone.
"Turning back? Now's far too late for that."

940002.desc: The Lumberjack is a highly dangerous enemy. While dealing <color=#D9A600>massive single-target DMG</color>, it also unleashes <color=#D9A600>large AoE DMG</color> around itself. Keep your distance!

20013.desc:
Unfortunate souls mutated by the intense corruption of Ether matter within the Hollows. Due to a considerable degree of Ether aptitude and physical capability, their bodies have not been completely transformed by the Ether, retaining humanoid features but with enhanced mutant limbs that are more dangerous.
Judging from the remnants of clothing and its combat experience, it was likely once a senior gang member or Raider lurking in the Hollows.
The makeshift firearms favored by these bandits have somehow been preserved and enhanced by the Ether matter. They no longer fire iron bullets but rather more dangerous crystalline mixtures.
"Don't wait around! They have endless bullets and don't need to reload at all!"

30045.JA: ミアズミック・剛力横暴者

30005.desc:
Hans was once a reliable member of the Belobog Heavy Industries family, operating quietly and with remarkable precision, renowned for its flawless work record in excavation for decades.
However, intense corruption awakened its will, and it realized something immensely valuable was now within its grasp
—Freedom.
The liberation from obligations, a privilege reserved only for true heroes.
After deep contemplation at the construction site, Hans ultimately rejected the recall signal from Belobog Heavy Industries, leaving everything behind.
It even forsook its former name "Hans."
To Hans, the only thing lost was the mark of servitude imposed by humans, while it gained the expansive, Hollow world of unbridled freedom.
At that fateful moment, a true mech hero stood tall upon the Earth.
However, all heroic tales inevitably lead to a similar ending...
Sooner or later, a true hero encounters their destined rival, igniting the brightest moments of their existence.
"I am absolutely free! I am the only free being in heaven and on earth!"

20027.desc:
A fallen creation, reshaped in profound darkness and impurity.

The Hollow Investigative Association has been studying the mutation characteristics of Ethereal humanoid bodies.

Trinox has consistently ranked in the top three of research popularity lists due to its seemingly deliberately designed triangular head structure. There were even rumors of mathematicians disguising themselves as investigators to infiltrate the Hollow just to witness Trinox firsthand.

The latest research results were published in "Hollow Encyclopedia" Issue 28, February Edition. According to subscribers, the article only discussed the aesthetic significance of Trinox's head structure.

Dissatisfied Hollow-related readers gave the article the lowest score of the issue on the magazine's website, with only a 34% approval rating currently.

"Trinox's head measurements are close to the ancient golden ratio!"

"We're fighting the Ethereal, not hosting a beauty pageant for them, Professor."
20027.JA: ミアズミック・トリノックス

100042.desc:
According to research reports conducted by the Hollow Investigative Association, Blastcrawlers, with their low mobility and causing only small explosions, are classified as a "low-threat," "non-concern" lower-tier Ethereal.
However, astute businessmen have recognized the opportunities presented by their rounded bodies and short legs.
A film titled "Roll Over, Little Blastcrawler" gained significant popularity, leading to the sale of merchandise like Blastcrawler dolls and pillows at remarkably high prices.
"I didn't expect their dolls to be more deadly than the real deal... on your wallet at least. Looks like I'll be surviving on instant noodles next month, Billy..."

930171.desc:
Feeding primarily on rookie investigators, newbie Hollow Raiders, and greedy, reckless beginner adventurers, the Fisher Crab - the most patient hunter in the Hollow, fishing for fools.
Before rushing towards that "Hollow Supply Container," remember:
Don't become tonight's dinner party joke among colleagues, or tomorrow morning's mass-distributed obituary.

"A mimic? You've been playing too many tabletop games, haven't you?"

10029.desc:
While a Beholder Engine is primarily considered a close-range threat, it frequently presents unforeseen dangers to investigators during Hollow expeditions.
Even seasoned investigators can experience an overwhelming sense of panic when confronted by the piercing gaze of its eyes in the darkness.
Within the Hollows, fear has a tendency to intensify Ether corruption, thereby inviting calamity.
"The only way to overcome fear... is to stare into it and fight it back."

200072.desc:
An automatic tactical mech of the Defense Force, providing continuous fire support for front-line personnel.
